subject: [Important] Your 1st Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by April 07, 2025 for $0.05 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
Tax Payments report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
TriNet 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© TriNet

Growth, Connection, and New Beginnings
Spring symbolizes renewal, fresh ideas, and growth—perfect for welcoming new board members, launching new initiatives, and highlighting inspiring discussions.
 
Spring Forward with Young SIETAR!
As the days grow longer and the world blooms into a new season, Young SIETAR is also embracing fresh beginnings! We are thrilled to welcome two new board members, including our new 
President
 and 
Membership Coordinator
, who bring passion and energy to our growing community. 
This spring also marks the launch of 
Think Intercultural
, our new webinar series designed to spark insightful conversations on intercultural topics. We’ve already kicked off with an inspiring session on intercultural relationships with Brazilian author 
Liliana Tinoco Bäckert
, and more recently with 
Dr. Catherine (Peyrols) Wu
, who guided us through practical frameworks for unlocking intercultural intelligence. Now we are looking forward to our next online event with 
Sean Dubberke
 who will share his wisdom and experience on starting a career in DEI & intercultural learning spaces. 
Whether you’re a longtime member or considering rejoining, now is the perfect time to connect, learn, and grow with us!
 
A New Chapter: My Vision for Young SIETAR
By Moutushi Künne, President, Young SIETAR
Taking on the role of President of Young SIETAR is both an honour and a responsibility I embrace with great enthusiasm. As we begin this new chapter together, I want to share my vision, goals, and hopes for the future of our vibrant community.
Young SIETAR is more than just a network—it’s a platform for young professionals passionate about international trade, innovation, and cross-cultural collaboration. It’s a space where future leaders connect, learn, and grow. And now, more than ever, I believe in the power of 
community
 to spark real change.
My Vision: A Dynamic, Inclusive, and Global Community
I envision Young SIETAR as a thriving hub where fresh ideas meet experience and diverse backgrounds fuel innovation. I want us to be known as a professional network and a 
movement
 that inspires young people to be bold, curious, and globally minded.
I aim to ensure that every member, whether attending their first event or leading a project, feels seen, heard, and empowered.
Goals for 2025 and Beyond
1. 
Make YS More Accessible and Visible
We’ll increase our presence on platforms like LinkedIn and Instagram to showcase our events and highlight member stories, achievements, and cross-border collaborations.
2. 
Create Meaningful Events
From thought-provoking panels to hands-on workshops, I want our events to offer more than just networking—they should provide real value, practical knowledge, and memorable experiences.
3. 
Promote Diversity and Inclusion
Our strength lies in our diversity. I aim to spotlight voices from all backgrounds, especially those navigating international careers, and build bridges between industries, cultures, and generations.
4. 
Encourage Mentorship and Peer Support
I’d love to foster more mentorship opportunities within YS—whether through formal programs or informal connections. We grow faster when we grow together.
5. 
Build Stronger Bridges with SIETAR and Beyond
Strengthening our collaboration with SIETAR and other international networks will open doors for our members, especially in policy discussions, trade missions, and intercultural projects.
A Collaborative Future
While I bring ideas and energy to the role, I know that real impact comes from collaboration. This is 
our
 community, and I invite you to help shape it. Whether you’re full of ideas or just looking for your place here, there’s room for you—and your voice matters.
Let’s build something bold, inclusive, and truly global. Here’s to new beginnings and exciting opportunities!
 
Webinar Highlights: 
How to Use Culture as a Catalyst for Change with Mithun Mridha
In this engaging session, Mithun Mridha explored the profound role of culture in driving meaningful transformation across personal, organizational, and societal levels. Drawing from real-world examples, he emphasized that culture is not a static entity but a dynamic force that can be leveraged to foster innovation, inclusivity, and progress.
Key Highlights:
Culture as a Living System
: Mridha discussed how culture evolves and influences behaviors, attitudes, and values, making it a crucial factor in implementing change.
Intercultural Competence
: He highlighted the importance of developing intercultural skills to navigate and adapt to diverse environments effectively.
Change Through Narrative
: Storytelling was presented as a powerful tool to shape cultural perceptions and create buy-in for new ideas.
Challenges & Resistance
: The discussion addressed common barriers to cultural transformation, such as deep-rooted biases and resistance to change.
Practical Applications
: Attendees learned actionable strategies for using culture to drive positive change in workplaces, communities, and beyond.
 
Think Intercultural Webinar Series
 
Intercultural Relationships 
with Liliana Tinoco Bäckert
Cultural Intelligence: A Practical Framework for Intercultural Training
In March, 
Liliana Tinoco 
Bäckert shared the wisdom she gained interviewing 
35 profiles of intercultural couples, exploring the challenges and nuances of intercultural relationships with the YS community. While this wisdom is compiled in her book,
"Amores Internacionais: Casei com um Estrangeiro, e Agora?"
 
 ("International Loves: I Married a Foreigner, Now What?")
 it is currently only available in Portuguese. 
However, based on the reception Bäckert experienced and the feedback YS received, this is an important and poignant topic in our community.  It is clear that interest and curiosity on this topic will only increase as our working and personal world become ever more international. 
The main take-away from this webinar: it is the small details that shape these relationships and continued open communication is paramount.  
Thanks to the interest and popularity of this topic it is possible the YS community will return to this topic. 
We were thrilled to host our webinar, 
"Unlocking Intercultural Intelligence: A Practical Framework for Intercultural Training,"
 featuring Dr. Catherine (Peyrols) Wu on April 1st.
Dr. Wu shared her extensive expertise in intercultural communication and training, providing participants with actionable strategies to enhance their intercultural competence. Whether attendees were seasoned professionals or new to the field, they gained valuable insights into navigating cultural complexities with confidence.
This wonderful event sparked engaging discussions and equipped participants with practical frameworks to apply in both personal and professional settings.
Thank you to everyone who joined us for this enriching session! Stay tuned for more opportunities to deepen your intercultural understanding.
Our Next Webinar
May 6th, 2025 - 19 - 20 CET
*Access Member only content or register for members-only events by logging in to your YS account. 
 
Unlocking the Power of Intercultural Competence with ELEVATE
Intercultural competence (ICQ) is no longer just a trendy term, it has become a crucial factor for success in 2025. That’s why 
Young SIETAR
 is proud to introduce the 
ELEVATE Project
, a two-year initiative co-funded by the European Union, aimed at redefining how organizations understand, measure, and develop ICQ.
With contributions from top researchers and practitioners across Europe, ELEVATE will deliver:
✔ 
Groundbreaking research
 on ICQ in companies
✔ 
An innovative intercultural assessment tool
 to identify gaps and opportunities
✔ 
An AI-assisted WebApp
 for personalized learning and development
✔ 
A comprehensive handbook
 for trainers and L&D professionals
To read more about this project either click the link below or check the 
YS Blog
. 
*Access Member only content by logging in to your YS account. 
ELEVATE Project
 
Bilingual Networking for Beginners: Your Secret Career Kryptonite
By Tanya Podvrsan, Membership & Mentoring Coordinator, Young SIETAR
Ever feel like your bilingual skills are gathering dust? By staying quiet about what you bring to the table, you’re not just missing opportunities—you’re letting companies struggle with problems you could help solve!
Bilingual networking isn’t just a fancy term—it’s your ticket to opportunities most job seekers dream of. Let’s take a look how to unlock this potential with some straightforward strategies that actually work.
Let me show you, in five steps starting from zero, how to tap into bilingual networking strategically to unlock doors most job seekers don’t even know exist!
Step 1: Figure out where you belong
Step 2: Craft your Bilingual Story
…
Read more on the YS 
blog
.
*Access Member only content by logging in to your YS account. 
 
We want to hear from you!
Do you have an idea for a webinar or a research project? 
Or perhaps an intercultural book or film recommendation that you would love to share? 
How about a training activity or research methodology that you would love our members to hear about? 
Contact us at 
board@youngsietar.org
.

subject: The Spring 2025 University of Chicago Magazine
body:
Preview the new issue of the Magazine. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
 
 
Hello, readers! This quarter’s 
Prepress Edition
 comes to you from Senior Associate Editor 
Susie Allen
, AB’09, who guest edited the Spring/25 issue of 
The University of Chicago Magazine
. Please enjoy her reflections on coming back to UChicago after a brief sojourn elsewhere. See you in July.
—Laura Demanski, AM’94, Editor
 
Dear Reader,
 
I didn’t think I’d get to write to you again. Regular readers might remember that in our Summer/23 issue, 
Laura Demanski
, AM’94, announced my departure from the 
Magazine
. But after a year at an institution with a slightly different view of Lake Michigan, I turned right back around.
 
My accidental sabbatical up north was the longest continuous stretch I’d spent away from the University of Chicago since I first arrived here as a student, extremely anxious and with bangs I now regret, in the fall of 2005. Leaving and coming back allowed me—for the first time, really—to see the University and Hyde Park through eyes at once fresh and full of nostalgia.
 
Everything familiar felt wonderfully new: 
Look, it’s Jimmy’s! Look, a Doc Films poster! Look, the terrifying moving bookshelves on the B level of the Reg that I still believe, against reason, might squish me!
 At the same time, everything new felt familiar: the freshly renovated Botany Pond, the new centers and institutes and majors and faculty members, the latest crop of students (who may, in 20 years’ time, regret their own bangs). 
Plus ça change
, as they say.
 
In the early months of my return, I found myself thinking about something I heard 
John Boyer
, AM’69, PhD’75, say at convocation in 2010: “Time, at least for an historian, is a powerful and an inescapable thing—it has its own reasons and its own cunning, and it brings changes that often enrich and yet never fail to complicate our lives.” I take this to mean that it’s OK for things to turn out differently than how you imagined, and that both the past and the present have something to teach us. (Then again, it’s also possible that Boyer was actually making an important point about the Habsburg Empire, and I completely missed it.)
 
I hope you will consider this my enthusiastic letter of recommendation for revisiting a place you once knew intimately and seeing it anew—with a sense of appreciation for both what it was then and what it is now. Conveniently, for anyone who might like to experience UChicago this way for themselves, 
Alumni Weekend
 is May 1–4, 2025. I am living proof: You can go home again.
 
Thank you for reading!
 
Best wishes,
 
 
 
Susie Allen, AB’09
Senior Associate Editor
sjallen1@uchicago.edu
 
P.S. We always appreciate hearing what readers want, so drop us a line anytime. And please stop by the 
Magazine
’s table in Ida Noyes during Alumni Weekend to talk to us in person!
 
 
 
Read the Spring/25 issues of the 
Magazine
 and the College supplement, 
The Core
:
 
•
 
Explore the work of UChicago’s MacLean Center for Clinical Medical Ethics.
•
 
Discover how a literary scholar is helping preserve Southern culinary heritage.
•
 
Learn about the many UChicago connections to the Scopes “Monkey Trial.”
•
 
Find out why millennials aren’t sure about having children.
•
 
Immerse yourself in 1970s counterculture in an oral history of the College during that turbulent decade.
•
 
… Plus more UChicago stories.
 
 
Read the Spring/25 issue’s
 
Alumni News
.

back issues
 
of the 
Magazine
.

.

Chicago, IL 60637

subject: Event Announcement: YS Think Intercultural Series: Starting a Career in the DEI and Intercultural Learning Spaces with Sean Dubberke, 06 May 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
YS Think Intercultural Series: Starting a Career in the DEI and Intercultural Learning Spaces with Sean Dubberke
When: 06 May 2025 7:00 PM, CEST
Where: Online
Will you be attending? Register below: 
Yes
 
Maybe
 
No
 
EVENT DETAILS:
Embarking on a career in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) and Intercultural Learning presents a unique opportunity to drive meaningful change in today's globalized world. In our upcoming webinar, esteemed expert
 
Sean Dubberke
, Principal & Vice President of Learning at RW3 CultureWizard, will guide you through this transformative journey. 
Webinar Highlights:
Understanding DEI and Intercultural Learning
:
 
Gain insights into the core principles and significance of DEI and intercultural competencies in modern organizations.
Career Pathways
:
 
Explore various roles and opportunities within the DEI and intercultural learning landscape.
Essential Skills and Qualifications
:
 
Identify the competencies and educational backgrounds that are highly valued in this field.
Overcoming Challenges
:
 
Learn strategies to navigate common obstacles and drive impactful initiatives.
Interactive Q&A Session
:
 
Engage directly with Sean to address your specific questions and receive personalized guidance.
Best regards,
Young Sietar

subject: WP Engine wins Gold Stevie Award for customer service excellence
body:
A gold standard in customer support 
WP Engine’s Customer Experience team earns top honors at this year’s Stevie Awards.
 
Find Out More Here 
 
A HISTORY OF EXCELLENCE IN SERVICE
Recognized leadership in customer support 
At WP Engine, customer satisfaction is more than a goal—it’s a driving force. That’s why we’re proud to announce that our Customer Experience (CX) team has earned the prestigious 
Gold Stevie Award
 for Customer Service Department of the Year in the Computer Services category! 
 
This incredible honor marks another major achievement in our long-standing history of excellence in customer service. Since 2015, WP Engine has won more than a dozen Stevie Awards, and our CX team is at the heart of this success. Continually setting the bar for exceptional support, their tireless dedication ensures that every customer experience is 
Customer-Inspired
. 
 
Here’s why this recognition is so special: 
Marks our 11th Stevie Award for customer support and our 15th Stevie Award overall
Highlights over a decade of consistent achievement at The Stevie Awards
Underscores the dedication and commitment of our incredible support agents  
Thank you to our amazing CX team and customers for making this possible. Let’s keep raising the bar together! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St, #1000, Austin,TX 78701

body:
You're Invited: BFI Public Event - AI, the Economy, and Public Policy on April 15th, 2025
 
View this email in your browser. 
 
 
YOU'RE INVITED
BFI Public Event - 
AI, the Economy, and Public Policy
Wednesday, April 15, 2025
David Rubenstein Forum
Friedman Hall, 3rd Floor
1201 E 60th St, Chicago, IL 60637
  
Refreshments and appetizers will be provided.
How is AI impacting the economy today? What might this mean for tomorrow? Join us as we gather UChicago economists, public policy experts, and the lead researcher on the new

Anders Humlum
 and 
Sanjog Misra
, UChicago Polsky Center’s 
Samir Mayekar
, and Anthropic’s

.

subject: µChicago: Trial and evolution
body:
µChicago, a monthly science newsletter. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
March 2025
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Trial and evolution
 
 
 
 
 
This summer marks the centennial of the Scopes Trial, a Tennessee court case that sparked public debate on evolution’s place in the classroom. Explore its UChicago ties in the 
Spring/25 issue of 
The University of Chicago Magazine
, and read on to discover the latest in evolution and ecology research.
 
 
 
 
 
These hips were made for walking
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
New reconstruction of the skeleton of 
Tiktaalik roseae
, a 375-million-year-old fossil fish. (Tom Stewart/Penn State)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A new 
skeletal reconstruction of 
Tiktaalik
, a 375-million-year-old fossil fish and one of the closest early relatives to limbed vertebrates, reveals that its ribs likely connected to its pelvis—a crucial step in the evolution of walking. Using microcomputed tomography scans, researchers modeled previously hidden bones and identified an area of connection, likely made up of ligaments, that could have allowed 
Tiktaalik
 to use its hind fins to push itself forward. Codiscovered in 2004 by Neil Shubin, the Robert R. Bensley Distinguished Service Professor of Organismal Biology and Anatomy, 
Tiktaalik
 remains key to understanding the evolutionary transition between aquatic and terrestrial life. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Natural selections
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
 
 
 
 
 
Armed and dangerous: New research found that octopus arms are controlled by a 
segmented nervous system
, allowing independent movement of each individual sucker and extremely fine motor control for grasping, exploring, and hunting. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2
 
 
 
 
 
Hotter, drier, spongier: A fungus that curbs invasive spongy moth populations is 
predicted to decline
—leading to more and more tree damage—due to the hotter, drier conditions brought on by climate change, according to computer models of species interaction.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
3
 
 
 
 
 
Sink or swim: The 
debate over 
Spinosaurus
’s hunting style continues
 as new studies clash on whether the sail-backed dinosaur’s dense bones enabled it to dive deep for its food or if the species was too buoyant to fully submerge.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Spotlight
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Bless the rains
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A new study suggests rainwater could have helped protocells develop their cell walls 3.8 billion years ago, a critical step in the evolutionary transition from RNA molecules to living organisms. (Illustration courtesy UChicago Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering/Peter Allen, Second Bay Studios)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Researchers may have uncovered how 
early protocells first formed
 from simple RNA droplets billions of years ago. Scientists have long believed these droplets were the starting point for early cellular life, but the theory had a vexing problem: Under evolutionary conditions, the droplets exchange RNA so quickly that the process would have resulted in identical clones—not in the genetic mutations needed for evolutionary change. A new study from the University of Chicago and the University of Houston exposed these naturally occurring droplets to rainwater, which helped form a protective “barrier” around the molecules and slowed RNA exchange. This breakthrough addresses a major challenge in origin-of-life research by demonstrating how early protocells could have maintained genetic differences, fostering natural selection. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In case you missed it
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
At the heart of it:
 
American Heart Month observed—a look at the latest in cardiovascular research.
 
 
 
 
On the map:
 
Molecular “mapping” uses powerful next-generation microscopes to create diagrams of cells, genes, and even entire organs to better understand how they work within the body.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Support biological sciences at UChicago.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sign up
 to receive 
µChicago
 monthly.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Biological Sciences Division
Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering
More science at UChicago News
More science at UChicago Magazine
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago 
5801 South Ellis Avenue, Chicago, IL 60637 
1.800.955.0065

subject: NYS Tax Department: Withholding tax changes are live! Get ready to file.
body:
Having trouble viewing this email? 
View it as a webpage
.
Know what to expect for your filing due April 30
The improvements to our withholding tax and wage reporting Web applications, forms, and related content are now live. This means the filing process for your quarterly return—Form NYS-45, 
Quarterly Combined Withholding, Wage Reporting, and Unemployment Insurance Return—
due April 30, 2025, will be different.
To ensure you're prepared, review some of the key changes to the filing process, 
before 
your return is due. For a complete list of all the changes, visit 
March 2025 changes to withholding tax and wage reporting
. 
Key changes
✔ On Form NYS-45, you must:
file 
all parts together
,
include all employees for the period as a single filing, and
separately report New York State, New York City, and Yonkers taxes withheld for 
each
 employee.
✔ We discontinued our stand-alone Wage Reporting Upload application for Form NYS-45 within Online Services.
If you're filing for 
one employer,
 you may upload this information using 
NYS-45 Web File
. Note: If you are filing for multiple employer identification numbers (EINs), you must file for each EIN separately. You 
cannot
 use NYS-45 Upload.
If you're a payroll service provider filing for 
multiple employers
 and have successfully tested submissions with the Tax Department, you may use the new 
NYS-45 Upload
. 
✔ You can electronically file 
all
 withholding tax returns, including amended returns. The amended return must be a complete, new filing (including 
all
 return parts and 
all 
employee records, not just the changes). 
✔ We discontinued Forms NYS-45-X and NYS-45-ATT. If you are exempt from the e-file mandate, file and submit a new and complete 
Form NYS-45
 according to the instructions on the form and mail it to the address provided. 
✔ You cannot request a credit across tax years. If you have an overpayment on your fourth quarter return, we will automatically send you a refund.
Withholding guidance
If you previously used NYS-45 Web File or Wage Reporting Upload, you should now refer to our 
NYS-45 Web File instructions
 for upload file formats and guidance for wage reporting.
If you are a payroll service provider filing for multiple employers, refer to:
the updated 
Publication 66
, 
Electronic Reporting of NYS-1 Information
, when filing with 
NYS-1 Upload
; and
the new 
Publication 72.5
, 
Electronic Reporting of Form NYS-45 Information
, when filing with 
NYS-45 Upload
 (we have retired Publication 72, 
Electronic Reporting of Form NYS-45 Information
).
If you file through FSET or are a software developer, visit 
Approved vendors for Federal/State Employment Taxes (FSET)
 for guidance.
Withholding tax reminders
✔ If you're reading this on your device, you're probably required to e-file your withholding tax returns. To make it easier, watch our 
NYS-45 Web File demo
 and 
NYS-1 Web File demo
. For all your filing options, see 
Withholding tax filing methods
.
✔ If you must file a paper return, see 
Form NYS-45
 and 
Form NYS-1
 to access the current forms and their instructions. Do 
not 
use saved or printed copies of these forms dated prior to 2025.
Withholding tax resources
Visit 
Withholding tax home
 for all your withholding tax resources. To stay up to date, 
subscribe to 
Withholding tax 
emails
.

subject: Thoughts From the MindTaming Blog
body:
Musings and Meditations on Mindfulness
 
 
March 2025
Welcome to Issue No. 13 of MindTaming!
 
 
 
On My Mind:
 
Staying Calm in the Turmoil
 
“We don’t have the luxury of despair.” – U.S. Senator Jon Ossoff
Dear Friends,
This issue of “MindTaming” marks the beginning of year 4 of this blog focused on mindfulness practices, tools and resources. It seems that this type of practice is helpful to more and more people all around me. The mailing list for my Wednesday meditation group is growing every week. (For more information about this group and how to join, see the Community section below.)
Meditation and mindfulness practices are one way to keep ourselves centered and grounded amid the chaos, uncertainty and constant change all around us, no matter where we stand politically. There are many other ways. We just can’t give up – or in. 
Maintaining a positive inner state, growing our resiliency, staying calm, getting rest and relying on our resources are all things we must do right now. Why? So that we can be our best selves, offer calm and peace to others and take action that aligns with our values and circumstances. As a white, well-educated, middle-class female, I can do a lot of things IF I take care of myself and my loved ones.  
When so many things around me seem out of my control, it’s useful to focus on what I CAN control. My inner state and my physical well-being are things I do have control over. And they impact the way I show up in the world and the kind of behaviors I display.  
Here are a few things I have found helpful in these trying times:
Keep things simple and don’t aim for perfection
. 
Not meeting every single deadline is ok – just let people know you’re going to be late. 
 
Realize that things take time
. 
Don’t expect immediate results and settle in for the long haul.
 
Don’t give up hope
. 
“Hope is a discipline, a practice and a commitment,” says American educator and activist Mariame Kaba. Follow her advice.
 
Practice the 4 Cs
. 
Community, Compassion, Curiosity and Courage. 
 
Have fun and do joyful things
. 
“Joy is an act of resistance,” declares poet Toy Derricotte in her poem “The Telly Cycle.”
 
Finally, be gentle with yourself. Try things out and experiment. Reverse course if something is not working. Most of all, remember what really matters to you – and trust your inner voice. 
How are you going to bring joy into your life in the coming months? I am exploring the heel of the Italian peninsula (Puglia) on a bicycle in April before participating in the final AIDS Vaccine charity bike ride near Atlanta in May. I hope both activities will help me stay centered and strong for the challenges ahead of us.
Wishing you a beautiful spring,
Rita
 
 
Taming:
 
Cultivating Your Practice
 
Get physical. Do something new with your hands.
When I get nervous or worried or when I am looking for distraction, I find it helpful to do something with my hands. By using my body in this way and engaging a different part of my brain, I tend to feel more grounded and centered. There are many ways to “get physical” (in addition to exercising, cleaning, cooking, gardening, etc.).  For instance:
Knitting, crocheting, needlepoint or other kinds of crafts
. I recently found a great “crocheting starter kit” at an outfitters store. BTW, men knit, too. :-)
 
Working on art projects
. We did a lot of that during the pandemic. Why not resurrect some of the activities from a few years ago? I mentioned taking up water-color painting in my last blog (finally scheduled for May – some things take a while to come to fruition).
 
Doing
 
jigsaw puzzles
. 
This is a still one of my favorite activities during colder weather. I currently have a very challenging 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle set up in my living room on a nifty new 
“
puzzle board
”
 that rotates.
 
Another “physical” practice that many of us have lost touch with and that almost seems ancient and somewhat quaint now is 
letter-writing
. Yes, I mean a REAL letter, not a greeting card or a postcard (although those arrive at my house less and less frequently, too). I wrote about four or five letters this past year, and it was hard. My fingers were not used to holding a pen for so long, and my handwriting looked like that of a toddler towards the end of the letter. Still, I enjoyed this type of focused activity, and I felt good about the amount of physical and mental effort I had put into it once I was done. I also sometimes cut out newspaper articles and send them to friends – and they always comment on how touched they are to have received my letter. Why not surprise one of your loved ones with a special handwritten gift sometime?
 
 
Community: Offerings for Practicing in Community
Are you drawn to meditation? Have you tried it but gave up again? 
Join us online every Wednesday from 12-12:30pm EST for our free 30-min Midweek Mindfulness Meditation, and meditate with people from around the world. 
Drop in as you can. Includes a check-in, a brief talk and 10-15 minutes of silent meditation. Free and open to anyone who is interested in practicing meditation in community. If you’d like to receive a weekly reminder to participate, sign up 
here
. 
 
Cool Resource
s
Minimal Reliance and Hope
"10% Happier with Dan Harris” podcast": 
"
9 Ways to Break Free From the Habits That Are Holding You Back with Dr. Rangan Chatterjee
"
 
(2/3/2025). In this episode, Dan Harris talks with UK-based physician and author Dr. Rangan Chatterjee about things that can hold you back, including the tendency to only listen to what “the experts” tell you instead of practicing “minimal reliance” and trusting your inner wisdom. 
Substack seems to be THE place where podcasters and bloggers post their offerings these days. I follow several writers, authors, teachers and activists whose posts I find interesting and inspiring. Here is a 
post by author and activist Patti Digh on HOPE
 
(3/25/2025)
 
and how to strengthen your “hope muscle.”
 
Click here to read  previous posts
 
 
 
Want to bring mindfulness to your workplace?
If you or your organization are interested in bringing mindfulness to your workplace and would like to discuss what that might look like, please 
contact me
 - and we'll set up an initial (no-obligation) meeting.
 
 
Tell me what you think!
I welcome any comment or question about anything mentioned in this blog. Email me at
 
rwuebbeler@interglobeweb.net
. If you do not want to continue to receive this blog click the Unsubscribe link below and uncheck MindTaming. To 
subscribe 
please 
email
 me.
﻿

subject: Event Announcement: YS Think Intercultural Series: Unlocking Cultural Intelligence: A Practical Framework by Dr Catherine Peyrols Wu, 01 Apr 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
YS Think Intercultural Series: Unlocking Cultural Intelligence: A Practical Framework by Dr Catherine Peyrols Wu
When: 01 Apr 2025 12:00 PM, CEST
Where: Online
The event is in 5 days, have you registered?
Yes
 
Maybe
 
No
 
EVENT DETAILS:
Expand Your Intercultural Skills with this interactive session!
Part 1
 – Essential Insights (20 min)
What is Cultural Intelligence (CQ), and how can you apply its powerful framework to elevate your intercultural training? Discover key concepts and real-world applications.
Part 2
 – Engaging Discussion & Live Q&A (40 min)
Dive deeper into CQ with expert insights, practical examples, and an open discussion to address your biggest challenges in intercultural training.
Key Discussion Points:
✅ Start with the end in mind – What does true intercultural competence look like, and how do people actually develop it?
✅ Seeing clearly through the clutter – How to assess and choose the best intercultural frameworks for your training.
✅ Your training roadmap – A step-by-step guide to using Cultural Intelligence (CQ) to design effective, results-driven intercultural training programs.
Join us for this dynamic session and gain actionable strategies to enhance your intercultural training impact! ✨
Let’s connect, learn, and lead together!
Best regards,
Young Sietar

.
Jameson, Mar 25, 2025, 6:44 AM PDT:
Hi Randall,
 
Thank you for chatting with Dropbox Support today! This email includes a ticket number for your reference.
 
To sum up our chat today, you mentioned that you were looking to refund the charge on 
randyst@gmail.com
 as it was renewed through the wrong credit card.
 
Thank you for confirming that you would like to proceed with refunding and downgrading your account. I have processed a refund for your purchase and your account has been downgraded.
 
Within a few business days, you'll see the amount of the transaction credited to the payment method used to purchase the subscription. You can see your account transaction history on your 
Billing
 page 
here
.
 
If you need anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out.
 
Regards,
Jameson
 
PS: Check out our library of quick videos that’ll teach you how to get the most out of your account:
https://help.dropbox.com/learn/video-tutorials

Chat transcript:
( 13:02:04 ) Visitor: Hello, my subscription renewed to the wrong credit card.
( 13:02:23 ) Jameson: Hello Randall, and thank you for contacting Dropbox support. My name is Jameson, and I will be more than happy to assist you with your issue, right away!

r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com

randyst@gmail.com
)
( 13:04:23 ) Visitor: A "family" subscription
( 13:06:06 ) Jameson: No worries Jack, can you please provide me with the transaction ID for that charge? As currently I cannot view that account for security reasons.
( 13:06:46 ) Visitor: K7VNQHSMVYWF
( 13:07:22 ) Jameson: Thank you Randall! I found it, it's 
randyst@gmail.com
( 13:07:36 ) Jameson: Would you like me to refund and cancel that subscription so that you renew with a new card ?
( 13:07:51 ) Jameson: Currently the payment cannot be transferred to another card.
( 13:08:02 ) Visitor: Yes -- i have updated the correct credit card in my account now (it ends in 8683)
( 13:08:18 ) Visitor: As long as we won't lose the subsccription/files/data -- sure.
( 13:08:58 ) Jameson: No worries, no files will be deleted, you may experience a syncing issue until you re-upgrade if you are using more than 2GB, but it should be fine, I will proceed with the refund then.
( 13:09:21 ) Visitor: great, thank you
( 13:10:16 ) Jameson: All done! I can confirm that the refund has been processed. Just to keep in mind, in general it takes 3 to 5 business days for a refund to be processed by payment vendors.
You can also access the receipt directly from this page: 
www.dropbox.com/payments
( 13:10:47 ) Visitor: ok, thank you.

( 13:11:26 ) Visitor: that's all, thank you!

subject: NYS Tax Department: Withholding tax online services will be down beginning March 20, 2025
body:
Having trouble viewing this email? 
View it as a webpage
.
 
Withholding tax online services will be down beginning March 20, 2025
In preparation for the changes to withholding tax and wage reporting forms and Web applications, the following online services will be unavailable beginning Thursday, March 20 at 4:00 p.m. Eastern Time:
NYS-1 Web File
NYS-45 Web File
NYS-1 Upload
NYS-45 Upload
New York State Federal/State Employment Taxes (FSET) program
View and Cancel a Scheduled Withholding Tax Payment 
We anticipate these applications being available Monday, March 24; we will notify you by email to confirm they’re available.
If you have a Form NYS-1 due March 21, make sure to electronically file by 4:00 p.m. Eastern Time on March 20. Alternatively, you can choose to file by paper so long as your return is postmarked by March 21.
Get the

subject: The secret to high-performing WordPress sites
body:
Optimize your website like a pro 
A performance blueprint for faster, more efficient WordPress
®
 sites.
 
SMARTER OPTIMIZATIONS FOR NEXT-LEVEL PERFORMANCE
Data-driven strategies to boost speed and efficiency. 
Your site’s speed impacts everything—from SEO to conversions. When every second counts, optimization isn’t optional. WP Engine’s new guide, Improve WordPress
 
Speed and Performance, provides expert-backed techniques for agencies and developers looking to enhance site performance.
 
Here’s what you’ll find inside: 
Essential insights into Core Web Vitals
: Learn how to optimize LCP, INP, and CLS for better search rankings and user experience. 
Advanced caching & CDN strategies
: Reduce latency and improve load times with smarter resource distribution.
Techniques for efficient asset management
: Optimize images, CSS, and JavaScript for peak performance. 
The managed hosting advantag
e: See how managed hosting can deliver up to 50% faster load times. 
Fine-tune your websites with data-driven performance enhancements. 
Download the Guide 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St, #1000, Austin,TX 78701

body:

subject: Need help with your technology?
body:
Good Morning Randall Stieghorst , Language & Culture Worldwide ,

Are you tired of the problems you are experiencing with your IT support?

Language & Culture Worldwide,   We work with local businesses to minimizing computer issues, keeping everyone productive and secure.

If you feel there is room for improvement please let me know.


Could we schedule a call/zoom this week or next week?



Best regards,

Stanley Bradford

Cyber Housekeeping Inc.
126 E Wing St 374....
Arlington Heights IL 60004

As a side note, feel free to let me know if you don't want to hear from me again

> Good Morning,  Randall Stieghorst, Language & Culture Worldwide ,  Just following up with you after reaching out several weeks ago. I’m with Cyber Housekeeping Inc out of Arlington hts – we are a local IT company that can help with all your technology needs –  from projects like Cloud-based Workflow Management, Document Management, File and Data Encryption, Office Moves, Server/Email Migrations, Offsite Backups, VOIP, Cybersecurity Initiatives, to just regular day-to-day Help Desk Support for your office. We're a small local company with 22+ years in the industry, and i would love to discuss how we can elevate your IT services and Cyber Security.  Could we schedule a call/zoom this week or next week? Best regards, Stanley Bradford Cyber Housekeeping Inc. 126 E Wing St 374..... Arlington Heights IL 60004 As a side note, feel free to let me know if you don't want to hear from me again On Tuesday, Jan 14, 2025 at 4:38 PM stanley.bradford@cyberhousekeeping.site wrote: > Good Morning, Randall Stieghorst , Language & Culture Worldwide, Do you have IT issues you can't resolve? I'm with Cyber Housekeeping Inc out of Arlington hts – we are an IT Managed Service Provider that can help you with all your technology needs – Consider us your own IT department, providing all the services that a large company's IT team would, but at a lower cost. We're a small local company with 22+ years in the industry, and i would love to discuss how we can elevate your technology and Cyber Security.  Could we schedule a call/zoom this week or next week? subject: The Future of WordPress & AI – Register for DE{CODE} 2025
body:
Don’t miss out on sessions from industry leaders and innovators who build on WordPress.
 
 
A Must-Attend Virtual Event for Everyone Who Builds on WordPress 
Date & Time: Tuesday, April 15 at 10:00am
Americas (CDT) | APAC (AEST) | EMEA (GMT) 
The web is changing fast—are you ready? Join thousands of WordPress
®
 professionals at DE{CODE} 2025, a half-day virtual conference designed to help you future-proof your skills, business, and strategies. 
Hear from 20+ industry experts, agencies, and WP Engine product leaders as they share clear, no-fluff insights on AI, performance, digital strategy, and more.
Secure Your Spot Today
Why attend DE{CODE} 2025? 
 
For Developers 
Exclusive insights on WordPress & AI from top industry leaders, breaking down how AI will reshape search and site development in the next 24 months.
 
For Agencies 
Strategies to win more business—how agencies are adapting to AI, shifting client needs, and emerging revenue models.
 
For Marketers & Brands 
Marketing and business strategy sessions covering AI-driven SEO, MarTech, and digital transformation.
Secure Your Spot Today 
Don’t miss your chance to be part of the conversation.

 and get ready to build a better web.

subject: March 12 webinar on Global Trust with Maria Todosiychuk
body:
Register Now for Our March 12th Global Trust Webinar! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Global Trust
Registration now for this March 12th Webinar!
 
 
 
 
March 12, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Data from international surveys sheds light on the following questions: What is trust and why does it matter? How profitable is trust? How much real trust is there in the world? How is trust created across cultures? Using a case study, this session is designed to provide practical insights and actionable takeaways that participants can apply in their personal and professional contexts. This Global Trust session will deliver ideas about one of the most fundamental cross-cultural challenges and about building real bridges. 
 
Daylight Savings Time begins in the U.S. on March 9 and in Europe on March 30, so please double-check your time zone to avoid confusion for our March 12 webinar.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
NON-MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER:
 
Based in Russia, 
Maria Todosiychuk
 is an old friend and colleague of SIETAR USA. She is known for her educational games such as Diversity Space Meeting, Culture Shock, The Global Team, and Intercultural Minefield which are used by many interculturalists across Europe and the USA for intercultural training. Honed over 15 years of working with major Russian and international corporations, Maria has her own style and views on how to teach tricky and complicated intercultural topics. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

Dear Accounts Receivable / Credit Manager:
 
University of Chicago

subject: Reminder: Special webinar on IRAs
body:
Register to join us on Thursday, March 20. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
An individual retirement account (IRA) isn’t just a smart way to save for the future—it can also be a powerful tool for giving back.
 
Did you know that your IRA can be used to make impactful gifts to the University of Chicago? The Office of Gift Planning actively partners with alumni and friends of the University to assist prospective donors and their advisers with their charitable goals and plans.
 
Join us for an interactive webinar to explore the essential aspects of planning an IRA gift, including the benefits, tax implications, best practices, and more. Ample time will be provided for your questions.
 
This event is free and open to all UChicago alumni and friends.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register »
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Thursday, March 20, 2025
11 a.m.–noon (CDT)
 
Via Zoom
 
If you have questions or require special assistance, please contact the Office of Gift Planning at 
giftplan@uchicago.edu
 or 773.702.3130.
 
Disclaimer: The Office of Gift Planning provides general information that we hope will be helpful to you in your tax, estate, and charitable planning. It is not intended as legal advice and should not be relied upon as legal advice. Figures, calculations, and tax information are based on US federal tax laws, regulations, rulings, and rates applicable at the time such information was prepared. Individual state laws can affect the use and benefits of IRA charitable giving. For advice or assistance with your situation, you should consult an attorney or other professional adviser.
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago
5801 South Ellis Avenue
Chicago, IL 60637
1.800.955.0065
 
 
This Planned Giving email was sent to randall@lcwmail.com.
If you no longer wish to receive these emails, you may 
update your communication preferences
 at any time.

subject: March 12 webinar on Global Trust with Maria Todosiychuk
body:
Register Now for Our March 12th Global Trust Webinar! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Global Trust
Registration now for this March 12th Webinar!
 
 
 
 
March 12, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Data from international surveys sheds light on the following questions: What is trust and why does it matter? How profitable is trust? How much real trust is there in the world? How is trust created across cultures? Using a case study, this session is designed to provide practical insights and actionable takeaways that participants can apply in their personal and professional contexts. This Global Trust session will deliver ideas about one of the most fundamental cross-cultural challenges and about building real bridges. 
 
Daylight Savings Time begins in the U.S. on March 9 and in Europe on March 30, so please double-check your time zone to avoid confusion for our March 12 webinar.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
NON-MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER:
 
Based in Russia, 
Maria Todosiychuk
 is an old friend and colleague of SIETAR USA. She is known for her educational games such as Diversity Space Meeting, Culture Shock, The Global Team, and Intercultural Minefield which are used by many interculturalists across Europe and the USA for intercultural training. Honed over 15 years of working with major Russian and international corporations, Maria has her own style and views on how to teach tricky and complicated intercultural topics. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

subject: Event Announcement: YS Think Intercultural Series: Intercultural Relationships with Liliana Baeckert, 04 Mar 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
YS Think Intercultural Series: Intercultural Relationships with Liliana Baeckert
When: 04 Mar 2025 7:00 PM, CET
Where: Online
The event is in 2 days, will you be attending?
Yes
 
Maybe
 
No
 
EVENT DETAILS:
Alternate Title: "
International Love
"
Liliana Baeckert, author of the book (in Portuguese) Amores Internacionais, will be talking about intercultural relationships and international love.
Different topics to be discussed
: 
Managing cultural differences within an international romantic relationship
Managing the difficulties in the new country, new culture
Cultural differences as cultural shocks
A glamorous loving relationship, but is this really the case? 
     → One of the couple is always the migrant, and what are the consequences of their migration? 
Who does this dynamic affect more,  women or men? 
Is there even a solution for this situation? 
Liliana Tinoco Bäckert is a journalist and holds a master's degree in Intercultural Communication from the University of Lugano, Switzerland. She is a member of the Network for the Study of Journalism of Migration and Refuge in Latin American Contexts (Remolinos), at the University of São Paulo. 
In Switzerland, where she has lived since 2005, she specialized in migration and in anti-racist practices. She currently works in an office for foreign integration.
In 2020, Liliana launched the journalistic book about the reality of Brazilian women who married people from other nationalities.
Best regards,
Young Sietar

General Liability:

Cyber:

Professional Liability:
 Can help cover costs like medical bills and lost wages for workplace injuries.
Commercial Property:
 Can help replace business property damaged by fire, water, or theft.

subject: You’re Invited! A New Era of Employee Benefits: The Hartford & Workday Wellness
body:
Sign-up today!
  
  
 
 
 
  
View as a webpage 
  
  
  
  
  
Sign‑up today for our 60‑minute session 
  
A New Era of Employee Benefits:
The Hartford & Workday Wellness 
  
Monday, March 17, 2025 
11:00 AM – 12:00 PM EST 
  
 
  
Register Today 
  
  
  
  
Join us as leaders from The Hartford and Workday unveil how our new tailored solutions and strategic integrations meet the unique needs of today’s workforce. Tune in to: 
  
 
•
Find out how the Workday Wellness experience helps provide personalized wellbeing offerings that can promote healthier and happier workplaces. 
  
 
•
Explore the industry leading benefits for employers who work with The Hartford and Workday for their benefits administration. 
  
 
•
Learn more about our flexible HR Tech solutions, consultative approach, and strategic platform connections. 
  
We’re honored to be one of the first benefits carriers to offer these innovative experiences and look forward to having you join us for this exciting moment of collaboration between The Hartford and Workday. 
  
  
  
  
Meet the Speakers 
  
 
  
Mike Fish 
Head of Employee Benefits at The Hartford

subject: Special webinar on IRAs
body:
Register to join us on Thursday, March 20. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
An individual retirement account (IRA) isn’t just a smart way to save for the future—it can also be a powerful tool for giving back.
 
Did you know that your IRA can be used to make impactful gifts to the University of Chicago? The Office of Gift Planning actively partners with alumni and friends of the University to assist prospective donors and their advisers with their charitable goals and plans.
 
Join us for an interactive webinar to explore the essential aspects of planning an IRA gift, including the benefits, tax implications, best practices, and more. Ample time will be provided for your questions.
 
This event is free and open to all UChicago alumni and friends.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register »
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Thursday, March 20, 2025
11 a.m.–noon (CDT)
 
Via Zoom
 
If you have questions or require special assistance, please contact the Office of Gift Planning at 
giftplan@uchicago.edu
 or 773.702.3130.

subject: 7 ways religion plays out in the workplace
body:
Some religious holidays may require specific behaviors, such as attending a place of worship, or refraining from certain activities.
Some religions have dietary restrictions or preferences (e.g., pork, vegetarian, no red meat, etc.)
Some religions require specific forms of dress
Some religions may frown upon behaviors they see as inappropriate (e.g., foul language) (meh)
Some religions require a specific time and a place to pray
Some religions may dictate how people should view certain behaviors in society at large (e.g., same-sex relationships)
Some spiritualities may lead people to focus on and question the human or environmental impact of an organization’s actions/decisions.
Others?
 
There’s an old saying that you should never discuss politics nor religion. But religion is a strong element of many people’s identities – so how do we better understand the impact religion and spirituality may have on our peers and colleagues in the workplace? The answer: by understanding more about what religion brings to a person’s identity and how we can allow for them to live out their values in the workplace, inclusively.
 
Actions we can take to be more inclusive
:
Allowing flexibility with time off/ time away for religious holidays or requirements, without necessary requiring PTO.
Ensuring food options at events or in the cafeteria include an array of religion-appropriate foods.
Allowing, and not preventing, colleagues from wearing certain religious items or clothing – head scarves, jewelry, etc.
Creating a place for individuals to pray or meditate privately.
Re-assign work that is undesirable to an individual, because of their religious beliefs, to another member of the team.
Others?
 
Actions that could create exclusion (to others)
:
Allowing one person’s religious beliefs to impact other coworkers or the team negatively (e.g., refusing to work with certain colleagues or clients, etc.)
Re-assigning work that is undesirable to an individual because of their religious beliefs to another member of the team (*this is a difficult one).
Requiring that people of one religion perform religious acts (like prayer) of another religion (e.g., asking everyone to join in a Christian prayer at a meeting).
 
 
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: Event Announcement: Intercultural Relationships with Liliana Baeckert, 04 Mar 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
Intercultural Relationships with Liliana Baeckert
When: 04 Mar 2025 7:00 PM, CET
Where: Online
Will you be attending?
Yes
 
Maybe
 
No
 
EVENT DETAILS:
Alternate Title: "
International Love
"
Liliana Baeckert, author of the book (in Portuguese) Amores Internacionais, will be talking about intercultural relationships and international love.
Different topics to be discussed
: 
Managing cultural differences within an international romantic relationship
Managing the difficulties in the new country, new culture
Cultural differences as cultural shocks
A glamorous loving relationship, but is this really the case? 
     → One of the couple is always the migrant, and what are the consequences of their migration? 
Who does this dynamic affect more,  women or men? 
Is there even a solution for this situation? 
Liliana Tinoco Bäckert is a journalist and holds a master's degree in Intercultural Communication from the University of Lugano, Switzerland. She is a member of the Network for the Study of Journalism of Migration and Refuge in Latin American Contexts (Remolinos), at the University of São Paulo. 
In Switzerland, where she has lived since 2005, she specialized in migration and in anti-racist practices. She currently works in an office for foreign integration.
In 2020, Liliana launched the journalistic book about the reality of Brazilian women who married people from other nationalities.
Best regards,
Young Sietar

subject: WP Engine Security_ Plugin Vulnerability Notification - Elementor Website Builder Plugin
body:
Hello,
At WP Engine we take the security of your sites very seriously, and make every effort to keep our customers aware of any potential security risks. We are reaching out to you today because we identified resources that may be utilizing a vulnerable version of the elementor plugin.
The lcwdev on lcwweb is running version 3.7.1.
WP Engine summary of the vulnerability: Data from an attacker could be interpreted as code by site visitors’ web browsers. The ability to run code in another site visitors’ browser can be abused to steal information, or modify site configuration.
This vulnerability’s information has been verified by Patchstack. Please note that questions related to this notification should be directed to Patchstack, the plugin author or the 3rd-party researcher for the most accurate information.
Resources providing further information on this vulnerability:
https://patchstack.com/database/vulnerability/elementor/wordpress-elementor-plugin-3-25-10-cross-site-scripting-xss-vulnerability?_a_id=473
 
To secure your site, please upgrade to the latest version of this plugin.
We always suggest making a backup before making any changes. You can learn how to do this in this article: 
https://wpengine.com/support/restore/
.
Would you like to avoid doing these updates manually in the future? Add the Smart Plugin Manager: 
https://my.wpengine.com/products/smart_plugin_manager
 to your plan today!
Finally, feel free to reach out to our Support team if you need assistance with backing up or updating your website!
Thanks,
-WP Engine Security Team

Global Trust
Unlocking the Power of Cross-Cultural Connections
Registration now for this March 12th Webinar!
 
 
 
 
March 12, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Data from international surveys sheds light on the following questions: What is trust and why does it matter? How profitable is trust? How much real trust is there in the world? How is trust created across cultures? Using a case study, this session is designed to provide practical insights and actionable takeaways that participants can apply in their personal and professional contexts. This Global Trust session will deliver ideas about one of the most fundamental cross-cultural challenges and about building real bridges. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
NON-MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER:
 
Based in Russia, 
Maria Todosiychuk
 is an old friend and colleague of SIETAR USA. She is known for her educational games such as Diversity Space Meeting, Culture Shock, The Global Team, and Intercultural Minefield which are used by many interculturalists across Europe and the USA for intercultural training. Honed over 15 years of working with major Russian and international corporations, Maria has her own style and views on how to teach tricky and complicated intercultural topics.

r.parrilla@lcwmail.com

a.kaur@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and not having seen the course, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: WP Engine Security_ Plugin Vulnerability Notification - Elementor Website Builder Plugin
body:
Hello,
At WP Engine we take the security of your sites very seriously, and make every effort to keep our customers aware of any potential security risks. We are reaching out to you today because we identified resources that may be utilizing a vulnerable version of the elementor plugin.
The lcwdev on lcwweb is running version 3.7.1.
WP Engine summary of the vulnerability: Data from an attacker could be interpreted as code by site visitors’ web browsers. The ability to run code in another site visitors’ browser can be abused to steal information, or modify site configuration.
This vulnerability’s information has been verified by Patchstack. Please note that questions related to this notification should be directed to Patchstack, the plugin author or the 3rd-party researcher for the most accurate information.
Resources providing further information on this vulnerability:
https://patchstack.com/database/vulnerability/elementor/wordpress-elementor-website-builder-plugin-3-27-4-authenticated-contributor-stored-cross-site-scripting-vulnerability?_a_id=473
 
To secure your site, please upgrade to the latest version of this plugin.
We always suggest making a backup before making any changes. You can learn how to do this in this article: 
https://wpengine.com/support/restore/
.
Would you like to avoid doing these updates manually in the future? Add the Smart Plugin Manager: 
https://my.wpengine.com/products/smart_plugin_manager
 to your plan today!
Finally, feel free to reach out to our Support team if you need assistance with backing up or updating your website!
Thanks,
-WP Engine Security Team

subject: Faster, smarter hosting for long-term growth
body:
The latest features built to elevate site performance
 
Get the most out of your hosting 
See how to optimize for speed, security, and savings with our new TCO guide.
 
COST VS. PERFORMANCE
WP Engine fuels growth, 
not expenses 
A high-performing website doesn’t have to come with high costs. Many businesses unknowingly invest in hosting that limits scalability, slows performance, and leads to higher expenses over time. Our latest guide explores how Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) impacts performance and how WP Engine keeps your site fast, secure, and cost-effective. 
 
Here’s what you’ll learn: 
How performance optimization can drive revenue and lower costs. 
The hidden expenses of low-cost or DIY hosting. 
How WP Engine’s managed hosting improves site speed and efficiency.
Cost-saving strategies for a high-performance digital presence. 
Your site should drive growth, not expenses. Read the full guide to see how smarter hosting decisions can optimize performance—without breaking your budget. 
Read The Guide 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St, #1000, Austin,TX 78701

Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and not having seen the course, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: FW: Updates on the legal State around DEI
body:
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 14:54
To:
 Office <office@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Updates on the legal State around DEI
 
Hey folks,
 
Wanted to send some more info to be aware of regarding developments around cases starting to be filed under ‘illegal DEI’. One of which concerns our client NBCU and Comcast (attaching two cases; Starbucks case from Attorney General along with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission) letter: NBC Universal and Comcast).
 
The suggestions being given by law firm; DLA Piper at this time to their clients are; 
 
Play as conservatively as possible; Take all DEI language from 10K reports and websites down.
 
Tomorrow’s hearing with the first people that are challenging the EO, will help shape what we can expect to see going forward. 
 
For now, the concern is there now seems to be two ways individuals can file against organizations and it is happening sooner than expected;
Whistleblower trainings (reporting trainings and DEI goals/metrics being imposed within organizations)
Federal False Claims Act (gov’t or individual can file. An individual can get 15-25% cut of the government contract that remains by filing a claim against a company). 
 
Please let me know if you have further questions or would like to connect with our contact at DLA.
 
Alisa
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner 
(She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner
LCW

subject: Helping  Reach More HR & L&D Leaders
body:
Hi Randall,

We're launching an early access program for a new AI-driven outreach platform, Opps.ai, and looking for a few select professional training and coaching firms to test it.

Right now, most firms rely on referrals and word-of-mouth, but that can be unpredictable. We help companies consistently start conversations with HR and L&D decision-makers who have budgets for professional development.

As an early adopter, you’ll get white-glove setup, direct input into shaping the platform, and priority access to new features.

Would it make sense to connect and see if this could work for LCW? Let me know, and I can send over a quick demo.

Best,
Michael
Founder & CTO @ Opps


P.S. Check out what we were able to do for Chek"Using Opps, we got our first 3 customers & secured $2.6M in seed investment." 

Chris Kane - Chek

 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and not having seen the course, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: RE: Arvin's work - question - not urgent
body:
Here is the priority list provided to Arvin. At the time there was not a deadline assisgned as I was trying to get a sense of her capability and speed. 
 
We can probably start putting dates to some of these. SME access will be the constraint.
 
The order of the transition will be:
Neurodiversity
Black Community
Women in Leadership
Generations
People with Disability

Help Position Yourself for Potential Future Opportunities!
 
Upgrade to the D&B Credit Insights Basic and gain deeper insight to your business scores and ratings.
Learn More
 
 
 
Hey Randall,
Many fast-growing businesses have one thing in common: they know why it’s important to help showcase their credibility. This is why 90% of Fortune 500 companies use Dun & Bradstreet scores and ratings data to help make business decisions. 
However, what suppliers, vendors, or potential partners think about your trustworthiness can affect growth opportunities. 
To thrive in today’s market, you need powerful relationships. Which is why thousands of others in your position use Credit Insights to get more familiar with their business scores before applying for financing, bidding on contracts, and maintaining relationships. 
Upgrade to Credit Insights Basic to access a full view of your:
PAYDEX® Score
Delinquency Score
Failure Score
D&B Rating
Maximum Credit Recommendation
SER Rating (real score views)
Plus, also gain additional insight with:
Payment History
Financials
Inquiries
Dark Web Monitoring (for up to 3 emails)
Ownership (Inside Company Operations feature
Stay informed with Credit Insights Basic. Upgrade for more! 
Upgrade Now
 
 
If you have any questions or want to start potentially impacting your business credit file, call one of our Account Managers at 1-844-544-1035 to learn more about our paid products.
 
*By upgrading to Credit Insights Basic you will be able to view and monitor the following five scores & ratings: PAYDEX score, Delinquency Score, Failure Score, Maximum Credit Recommendation, and D&B Rating.
 
D&B Credit Insights Basic will automatically renew each year or month at the list price in effect at the time of renewal (depending on your billing selection), which may be higher than today’s price. subject: Event Announcement: How to use Culture as a Catalyst for Successful Change, 26 Feb 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
How to use Culture as a Catalyst for Successful Change
When: 26 Feb 2025 6:30 PM, CET
Where: Online
Will you be attending?
Yes
 
Maybe
 
No
 
EVENT DETAILS:
Change is inevitable, but achieving success in change initiatives is not guaranteed. You may be familiar with the quote from Heraclitus: "The only constant in life is change." In both professional and personal contexts, the key to a smooth and effective transformation lies in understanding and managing culture. Both organizations and individuals need to be culturally intelligent to navigate change successfully in today’s interconnected and rapidly evolving world. 
Intercultural management is a crucial, yet often overlooked, factor in driving successful change. This webinar, designed for Young SIETAR members—independent educators, trainers, coaches, and consultants—will explore how you can leverage cultural awareness and adaptability to create impactful and sustainable change.
In our globalized world, stakeholder management has become increasingly complex, with diverse stakeholder expectations and the growing influence of technology. Organizations must navigate the intricate dynamics of cultural differences while balancing the needs of employees, clients, and other stakeholders. The role of technology in communication and collaboration further highlights the importance of culturally intelligent leadership in change management. By understanding how cultural values influence perceptions of change and acceptance, attendees will gain valuable insights into fostering more inclusive, resilient, and effective change processes. 
Key Focus Areas:
●
      
Culture as a Change Enabler:
 How cultural values shape perceptions, behaviours, and resistance to change.
●
      
Practical Strategies: 
Tools and techniques to align change initiatives with cultural dynamics for smoother adoption and engagement.
●
      
Overcoming Resistance
: Addressing cultural barriers that hinder individual, team, and organizational transformation.
●
      
Real-World Applications:
 Interactive discussions on integrating culture into change management frameworks.
●
      
Personal and Professional Impact
: How can intercultural management skills enhance leadership, collaboration, and long-term adaptability?
●
      
Stakeholder Considerations
: Navigating diverse stakeholder expectations and leveraging technology to enhance cultural alignment in change initiatives.
Join this engaging and interactive session to discover how intercultural management can be the missing piece in your change leadership toolkit!
Mithun Mridha is a PPM Expert, Organizational Transformation Consultant and Agile Coach within Capgemini's Business Transformation Expertise Centre in Paris. He also happens to be an Intercultural Enthusiast and an International Speaker. He helps senior executives foster strategic alignment, improve project performance, and develop future leaders. He has successfully served multinationals from diverse sectors and travelled extensively in 60 countries. He has lived and worked for long periods of time in four countries. Mithun has taught International Business, Intercultural Management and Project Management at the following prestigious European Business Schools - ENPC - ParisTech, Paris Dauphine, ESSCA, EM Normandie and Freie Universität Berlin.
Best regards,
Young Sietar

subject: Event Announcement: Young SIETAR General Assembly 2025, 02 Mar 2025
body:
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
You are invited to the following 
event
:
Young SIETAR General Assembly 2025
When: 02 Mar 2025 11:00 AM, CET
Where: Online
It's that time of the year for (digital) General Assemblies and we as Young SIETAR have been doing digital GAs for many years.
 
GAs are an important part of any organisation and this year we as a board would encourage you to join us at our General Assembly of Young SIETAR that is taking place on 
Sunday, March 2nd,2025 at 11a
m CET.
As our valued members are located across the globe, this is an important time for the Board to speak directly to them (and vice versa) about our previous year's actions as well as our future plans for the year ahead. The Board would encourage you, member, to join us so your voice will be heard. 
As some important decisions concerning the future of Young SIETAR will be taken, we will also offer our active membership to vote beforehand by filling out an online (
Voting by proxy for Young SIETAR General Assembly2023.docx
) document. 
Our GA will be held on 
Sunday, March 2nd,2025 at 11a
m CET
.
In order to join us online, please register here:
https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/14280901543791448
After you’ve registered you will receive an e-mail if your registration was successful. Please make sure to join a few minutes before the start of the GA as you may have to download the software to be able to access the webinar.
The proposed agenda for the General Assembly is as follows: 
Part 1:
 
Welcome & introductions
Finalization of ther GA 2025 agenda. 
Minutes from previous GA (YS GA, 2024) 
Part 2:
 
Announcements from the board
Secretarial & Finacial overview - presentation and voting 
Changes within the Board - proposals, applications, and voting 
Part 3
: 
Annual strategy 2025 - presentation and voting
Budget 2025
Membership fee update for the year, 2025 - proposal and voting 
Question and Answer session
We expect the call to last no longer than 1.5 hours.
After the discharging of the former board members, voting will be required to approve the proposed new board members. Upon approval the new board members will be officially installed for a period of two years. The reasons for officially discharging and installing board members are legal issues, responsibilities and liability.
All members are cordially invited to apply and 'step up to the plate' for any open position advertised.
We’re looking forward to having the General Assembly together with you on 
Sunday, March 2nd,2025 at 11a
m CET,
 and are looking forward to holding our annual assembly virtually once again. 
Will you be attending?
https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/14280901543791448
EVENT DETAILS:
It is that time again for our (digital) General Assembly (GA). 
The General Assembly, consisting of all members of YS, is the most powerful body of our association. To ensure the daily activities of YS, the General Assembly entrusts certain tasks and responsibilities to a small group of people, the executive committee, which we call the Board. The members of the board are chosen by the General Assembly by means of voting.
The General Assembly is also meant for discussing other important ongoing issues of importance to YS and its members.
 
At least once a year a General Assembly meeting is called together by the board in which it renders an account and informs the members of the administrative and financial situation of the association. It does so in the form of a secretarial and financial report of the past year and a policy and financial preview of the coming year. The members can either approve or disapprove of the presented results and future plans.
As our valuable members are located across the globe, this is an important time to speak directly to you about our previous year's actions as well as our future plans. 
All members of YS are invited for this meeting and have a right to vote.
This event is an important part of any organization and this year we as a board encourage you to join us so your voice will be heard.
Please register for this event 
here
.
Best regards,
Young Sietar
Follow us on LinkedIn
 | 
Follow us on Instagram
 | 
Find us on Facebook
If you no longer wish to receive these emails you can 
unsubscribe
 at any time.

subject: How was your recent renewal experience?
body:
Tell us about it.
 
Hi Randall,
 
To ensure we are meeting your needs and exceeding expectations, you'll be receiving a brief survey designed to gather feedback on your recent renewal experience with OneDigital. Please be on the lookout for the survey invitation via email, coming from Camry Blaising, our EVP of Operations, and take a moment to let us know how we are doing. 
 
As a valued OneDigital customer, your voice is important, and your candid opinion makes a big difference in improving our services. 
 
Thank you in advance for your time and feedback. 
 
Tammy Phillips
tphillips@onedigital.com
