subject: Business banking made simple - Randall, get started with Lili
body:
Manage your finances with ease.
 
Randall Stieghorst
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
 
 
Hi Randall,
Starting your business is a big step, and having the right business banking solution can make all the difference. One thing is certain: you need a banking partner that works as hard as you do. Lili is here to support you with a business checking account that’s built for entrepreneurs and small business owners like you.
Here’s why business owners choose Lili:
 
Whether you’re just starting or looking to streamline your financial operations, Lili is the business banking solution you can count on.
Our Vision & Mission
We’re dedicated to empowering businesses with the essential tools and support needed for success. Our platform streamlines banking, accounting, and tax management, enabling you to focus on what truly matters—scaling and achieving your vision.
© 2025 Lili App Inc, all rights reserved.
PO Box 1809, New York, NY 10156
 
This email is an advertisement.
If you no longer wish to receive these emails, please 
unsubscribe
The content provided herein, and the processing of your data is governed by Lili’s 
Terms of Use
 and 
Privacy Policy
, as well as the 
Sunrise Banks Account Agreement
 and 
Sunrise Privacy Policy
. Dun & Bradstreet may earn commission for your participation in Lili’s program.
1 The Annual Percentage Yield (“APY”) which is effective 10/1/2025 for the Savings Account is variable and may change at any time. No minimum balance required. Must have at least $0.01 in savings to earn interest. The APY applies to balances of up to and including $1 million. Any balance over $1 million will not earn interest or have a yield. Available to Lili Pro, Lili Smart and Lili Premium account holders only.
2 Fee-free Overdraft is a discretionary overdraft program for debit card purchases only, offered for Lili Pro, Lili Smart, and Lili Premium Account holders. You must meet eligibility requirements and enroll in the program. Once enrolled, your Account must remain in good standing with a deposit and spending history that meets our discretionary requirements to maintain access to the feature. BalanceUp overdraft limits of $20-$200 are provided at our sole discretion, and may be revoked any time, with or without notice. Please refer to our 
BalanceUP Service Disclosure
 for more details.
3 By integrating your Lili Business Bank Account through the D&B Credit Insights banking integration feature, there may be potential for you to positively impact your Delinquency and Failure Scores. Dun & Bradstreet requires a minimum of six months of business banking transaction history to be able to potentially impact these scores.
Lili is a financial technology company, not a bank. Banking services are provided by Sunrise Banks, N.A., Member FDIC. The Lili Visa® Debit Card is issued by Sunrise Banks, N.A., Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa U.S.A. Wire Transfer service provided by Column Bank N.A., Member FDIC.
Please don’t reply to this email, it won't reach us.
If you need to contact our team, 
support@lili.co
 is the way to go!

 ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏
IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
 
Reminder:  IDI Qualified Administrators (QAs) will receive an email to claim your IDI QA account. Please use the email address associated with your IDI account to log into the new IDI Platform on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
. 
 
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting today,
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025 at approximately 3:00pm EST
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the new Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by clicking the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser

You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

View this email in your browser
Embracing (more) change and collaboration in 2025!
Adapting to evolving global challenges together.
Like fashion, January is out. 
February is in. 
The month that blinked and was gone. 
It is already February and we on the Board have so much to update you on. 
Read on to find out more…
 
“Ting”: The Global Coaching Secret
In Chinese culture, the concept of 
Ting
 (聽) encompasses listening with more than just the ears—it involves the eyes, heart, and mind, symbolising focused and holistic attention. 
Effective global coaching, particularly when bridging diverse contexts like the Global North and South, mirrors this approach. Coaches who 
Ting
 are fully present, observing body language, understanding emotional undercurrents, and engaging deeply with coachees. 
Moreover, treating coachees as valued partners—akin to royalty—creates a space of respect and empowerment. 
This mindful and intentional approach fosters authentic connections and drives transformational growth.
We have Jeremy Solomons to thank for his insight on 
Ting 
(聽)
, from his recent webinar on Global Coaching (See below). 
 
Global Coaching webinar with Jeremy Solomons
Helping us close out the month of January was mentor and dear friend of Young SIETAR, Jeremy Solomons. In his webinar on global coaching, he helped participants better understand the complexities and nuances of coaching in the Global North and the Global South. 
Three Important Takeaways:
Cultural Adaptation Is Essential:
 Coaching approaches that work in the Global North may not translate directly to the Global South. Coaches must be adaptable, listening carefully to the cultural and contextual needs of their coachees to foster effective and respectful communication.
Equity and Empathy Build Stronger Connections:
 Understanding the unique challenges faced by individuals in different economic and social contexts requires empathy. Successful coaches create equitable spaces where diverse perspectives are acknowledged and valued.
The Importance of Personal Connection:
 Building trust and rapport is particularly crucial when coaching in the Global South. Personal connections often form the foundation of successful coaching relationships. Taking time to get to know coachees on a human level, beyond professional objectives, can significantly enhance communication and engagement.
Members can access the recording of this webinar and Jeremy’s PDF slides in the members-only section of our website, under Training and Education.
Young SIETAR . org
 
Upcoming Events
We are working on a few great events free for members. Mark your calendars and please consider joining us. 
First, in February…
26.02.25: An evening with the ever enigmatic Mithun Mridha. Mridha is man who wears many hats and is planning to share his vast wisdom and experience as an Organisational Transformation Consultant, Coach, and Intercultural Enthusiast. Stay tuned as more information is on the horizon. 
Next we will have two events in March, so buckle up! 
02.03.25: It is that time of year again - time for our General Assembly. This is our members chance to see exactly what the YS Board has been up to in 2024 and what our plans are for 2025. Not to mention we hope to introduce new potential board members. Plus,  all members get to vote! Join us, won’t you?! 
04.03.25: We are pleased to announce the first webinar in a new series for 2025, ‘Think Intercultural’ with a plethora of wonderful speakers. 
CONFIRMED  GUEST SPEAKERS
Liliana Baeckert, Brazilian living in Switzerland, author of the book (in Portuguese) Amores Internacionais, who will be talking about intercultural relationships.
Liliana Tinoco Bäckert | LinkedIn
Dr. Catherine Wu, French living in Singapore, Professor of Cultural Intelligence and Global Leadership at Nanyang Technological University Singapore, who will be talking about designing an intercultural training having CQ in mind.
Dr. Catherine (Peyrols) Wu | LinkedIn
Sean Dubberke, Principal and VP of Learning at RW3 Culture Wizard, a firm specialized in DEI and intercultural training.
Sean Dubberke | LinkedIn
Jane Jihye Kim, South Korean based in South Korea, Intercultural Consultant, who will be talking about gender equality in South Korea. 
Jane Jihye (김지혜) Kim | LinkedIn
Members, don’t forget to check your inboxes as more information on all of these events is coming soon. 
View
 
We want to hear from you!
Do you have an idea for a webinar, a research project? 
Or perhaps an intercultural book or film recommendation that you would love to share? 
How about a training activity or research methodology that you would love our members to hear about? 
Contact us at 
board@youngsietar.org
.

Young SIETAR Karel De Vijfdestraat 5 'S-Hertogenbosch, Brabant 5216 AP Netherlands

Hi, I addressed or have questions about your yellow-highlighted items. 
 
I did some revisions to the narration at the beginning, but didn’t have time to fully review. Can review at a later time. 
 
Here are some neurodiversity resources that I had saved in my bookmarks, which may be useful to you (in chronological order):
 
Society For Neurodiversity
12.2.24-HR Magazine - To unlock neurodiverse workers' potential, work needs a rethink
10.26.24-Embracing Neurodiversity in the Workplace: A Call for Change and Burnout Prevention | LinkedIn
10.2.24-Majority of neurodivergent workers feel overwhelmed at work, research finds
10.8.24-How neurodiversity in the workplace drives business success | World Economic Forum
9.12.24-Cracking the Neurodiversity Code: Proven Strategies from Dell, EY & Ubisoft (use AWB's email address)
7.9.24-Autistic Employees Find New Ways to Navigate the Workplace - The New York Times
6.16.24-Embracing Neurodiversity in the Workplace: Why It Matters for DEI
3.17.24-Neurodivergent folks experience many workplace challenges, including… | by Brian Can Help! | Medium
3.7.2024-Neurodivergent Employees Experience Workplace Discrimination - HRO Today
5.3.2023-Helping Neurodivergent Employees Succeed
 
 
The deck is here:
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla

From:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 8:58 AM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Arvinder Kaur <
a.kaur@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and 
not having seen the course
, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: RE: MS Exchange account
body:

To be transparent, I think LCW may need to keep our emails active until such time as things are resolved with the banks, the notes, etc. There is significant historical record here of important conversations and although we can “download a PST file”, I’m never confident that the full breadth will be correctly saved. If things were in a different place, I wouldn’t care about losing the details of conversations over the past 3 years…but as you know, they are not in a trustworthy place.
 
Happy to chat more if necessary,
Thx,
R

subject: D&B Credit Insights: Business Scores & Ratings 101
body:
Curious about the scores available in Credit Insights? Here's a quick guide.
 ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­   
Business Credit Scores & Ratings: What You Need to Know 
See My Scores
 
Your D&B Credit Insights username is: randall@lcwmail.com
Why are business credit scores and ratings important to understand for your business?
A company’s business credit scores and ratings are designed to help other organizations gauge potential risk and understand the company’s financial health. A company may use this information when deciding to extend business credit to a customer or to contract with a supplier, a bank may consult a business credit report when deciding to offer a loan, and business owners may use the information in their business credit file to help demonstrate their credibility.
Here are the Dun & Bradstreet scores and ratings available to view in D&B Credit Insights free tier: 
D&B PAYDEX®
, 
Delinquency Predictor Score, 
Failure Score & SER Rating. 
Plus, summaries of your Payment History, Financials, and Inquiries are also available to view. 
Here’s the low down on what these scores can mean to your business:
D&B PAYDEX
®
The PAYDEX® (Payment Index) is an index that summarizes how your business has historically paid its bills based on information in the Dun & Bradstreet Data Cloud. Your business’s PAYDEX® Score summarizes what your business’s payment habits have been to date.
How You Can Potentially Impact Your Company’s PAYDEX Score:
The PAYDEX Score reflects a business’s credit history and payment trends. Two of the most effective ways to potentially improve your business’s PAYDEX Score are (1) paying your bills on or ahead of time and (2) making sure your suppliers and lenders are reporting your payments to Dun & Bradstreet.
D&B Delinquency Score
The Delinquency Score predicts the likelihood that your business will pay its bills on time in the future based on information in the Dun & Bradstreet Data Cloud. Your Delinquency Score comes in three flavors; a Class, a Percentile and a Raw Score – allowing for different levels of granularity.
To creditors, suppliers and other businesses, your Delinquency Score can help measure if your business will pay on time.
How You Can Potentially Impact Your Company’s Delinquency Score:
Integrate your business bank account transactions to D&B Credit Insights
Verify and confirm your business's start date, industry, and number of employees, and update in D-U-N-S
®
 Manager if necessary
D&B Failure Score
The Failure Score predicts the likelihood that a company will declare bankruptcy or close its doors in the next 12 months. Your Failure Score comes in three flavors; a Class, a Percentile and a Raw Score – allowing for different levels of granularity.
To creditors, vendors, suppliers and other businesses, your Failure Score measures their risk of loss associated with doing business with your business.
How You Can Potentially Impact Your Company’s Failure Score:
Integrate your business bank account transactions to D&B Credit Insights
Validate your public filings, including Suits, Liens, Judgements & UCC Filings
Verify and confirm your business's start date, industry, and number of employees, and update in D-U-N-S
®
 Manager if necessary
Upload your business's financials via D-U-N-S Manager
D&B SER Rating
The D&B Supplier Evaluation Risk (SER) Rating predicts the likelihood that a supplier will cease operations or become inactive over the next 12 months based on information in the Dun & Bradstreet Data Cloud.
How can I potentially impact this rating?
Upload your business’s financials in D-U-N-S Manager
Validate your public filings. 
Suits
Liens
Judgments
UCC Filings
Verify the industry your business works in and update in D-U-N-S Manager if necessary.
Verify your business’s number of employees and update in D-U-N-S Manager if necessary.
See My Scores
 
 
If you have any questions or want to start impacting your business credit file right away, call one of our Account Managers at 1-844-544-1035 to learn more about our paid products.
Is Your Business Information Up to Date?
Did you know that you can request updates through our free D‑U‑N‑S® Manager? Having accurate information is one of the first steps in building a strong business credit profile.
Update My Information
 
 
*D&B Credit Insights Free only shows directional score changes to four of your Dun & Bradstreet credit scores and ratings and allows you to receive email and product alerts to such directional changes. To see actual scores and ratings, or to receive notifications related to your company’s legal events, we recommend that you upgrade to one of our paid credit monitoring solutions.

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Soon
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting next
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the newe Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by click at the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser
Copyright (C) 2025 IDI, LLC. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Our mailing address is:
IDI, LLC 2915 Olney Sandy Spring Road Suite D Olney, MD 20832-3503 USA 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

subject: Get the Most Value Out of D&B Credit Insights: Here's What's Next
body:
You're signed up - Here's what we recommend next
 ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­   
Maximize the Potential Impact on Your Business with D&B Credit Insights  
Your D&B Credit Insights username is: 
randall@lcwmail.com
See My Scores Changes
 
 
Hello Randall,
Whether you're a brand-new business or a seasoned pro, we know that business credit scores and ratings may be uncharted territory for you.
Here's the good news: You've taken the first big step to learn about and monitor your business credit file. But what should you do next? Here are 3 steps to help you get the most out of your experience.
 
 
 
Sync Your Banking Data
Seamlessly and securely integrate your business banking data with Credit Insights. When you connect your banking transaction history (spanning between 6-24 months), Dun & Bradstreet can potentially use it as the reference to impact your business' Delinquency Score and Failure score.
Sync to Credit Insights
 
 
 
Verify Your Business Information
Verify that the information in your Dun & Bradstreet business profile is correct and up to date. You can easily submit update requests through D-U-N-S
®
 Manager via Credit Insights for free.
Log In to Credit Insights
 
 
 
Talk to a D&B Small Business Advisor
Our dedicated representatives are here to support you every step of the way. Schedule a consultation to gain deeper insights into how Credit Insights can align with your business goals and potentially help you grow.
Call Today: 844-544-1035
 
 
If you have any questions or want to start potentially impacting your business credit file, call one of our Account Managers at 1-844-544-1035 to learn more about our paid products.
 
*D&B Credit Insights Free only shows directional score changes to four of your Dun & Bradstreet credit scores and ratings and allows you to receive email and product alerts to such directional changes. To see actual scores and ratings, or to receive notifications related to your company’s legal events, we recommend that you upgrade to one of our paid credit monitoring solutions. 
Privacy and Terms of Service Notice:
Your privacy is important to us; please see our 
Privacy Policy.
 To unsubscribe from future emails 
click here
, or to update your email preferences, please 
click here
.
 
 
Please add no-reply@mail.dnb.com to ensure delivery of our emails to your inbox.
 
This is a notification regarding your free product subscription with Dun & Bradstreet. By purchasing or obtaining a product, you are deemed to have agreed to the terms of our 
Product License Agreement
. 
 
C-CIFREE-WEL2-0824
 
©2024 Dun & Bradstreet, Inc. All rights reserved. 5335 Gate Pkwy, Jacksonville, FL 32256, USA

subject: Re: Storyboard v1
body:
Hi Randall,
Sure, we can keep the files in one place. It will be easy for both of us.
Thanks,
Arvinder
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, February 6, 2025 9:03 PM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Storyboard v1
 
 
Hi Arvinder,
In light of the fact that there is no better transcript to base the elearning on, I have created a Storyboard v1 doc that will rely exclusively on the speakers notes *
AND
* new narration that will be drafted by me (based on the document you provided to me). I have saved it in the INBOX for Arvinder folder. I will use this as the working folder for now, unless you have a different location you’d prefer we work collaboratively in.
 
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: Re: Recordings of Spotlights?
body:
Understood. Thanks so much! Appreciate you helping out with this!
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, February 6, 2025 5:17 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Recordings of Spotlights?
 
 
Sounds good. I need to get a rough draft script into the storyboard [for neurodiversity] before I can pass it to Arvin to work on the ID part of it. Speaker’s notes from the PPT are helpful, but they’re not the most ideal narration in many/most cases. 
-R
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 6, 2025 16:05
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Recordings of Spotlights?
 
Hi! Whenever you have time and can assess... 
 
I'd love to have a timeline (even if rough) of when Arvin will be completed with each EL/ML. I'd love to start announcing to clients when they can expect things to be ready.
 
Also, when you get to it, it would also be good to have an idea of how quickly, in general, she can turn things around / create a new ML/EL (on average).
 
No rush on this. I know you're just jumping in & she's still new 
🙂
.
Thanks!

Subject:
 Recordings of Spotlights?
 
 
Hey all,
As a first step to converting various spotlights to eLearnings, the easiest and most effective approach would be to transcribe a live course that was presented and edit that script down to one that is appropriate for an eLearning.  Do any of you know if we have [Zoom] recordings of any of these spotlights?
 
Neurodiversity
Black Community
Women in Leadership
Generations
People with Disability
 
If so, please provide us (Arvin and me) with a link to those recordings.  Thank you!!!
-R
 
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: Storyboard v1
body:
Hi Arvinder,
In light of the fact that there is no better transcript to base the elearning on, I have created a Storyboard v1 doc that will rely exclusively on the speakers notes *
AND
* new narration that will be drafted by me (based on the document you provided to me). I have saved it in the INBOX for Arvinder folder. I will use this as the working folder for now, unless you have a different location you’d prefer we work collaboratively in.
 
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

subject: FW: Please Review and Complete your Tax Organizer for Weiss & Company LLP
body:
From:
 Weiss & Company LLP <noreply@safesendreturns.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, January 23, 2025 16:52
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Please Review and Complete your Tax Organizer for Weiss & Company LLP
 
 
Complete Your 2024 Tax Organizer 
Thank you for choosing Weiss & Company LLP this tax season. To complete your tax organizer online, click the "Let's Get Started" button below.
You can upload your documents as PDFs via the SafeSend Organizer. If you need to take pictures, use an app that converts them to PDFs. We recommend uploading all documents at once after completing the organizer.
Once you and/or your spouse have filled out the organizer, click "FINISH" on the Confirm Completion screen to notify us of completion.
If you need to upload more documents later, select "Continue Later." Otherwise, choose "Finish" when done.
Alternatively, you can upload documents to the Weiss client portal (
https://www.clientaxcess.com/#/user/login
), mail, or drop them off. Please submit your documents once to avoid duplication.
Save this email for easy access to your organizer. You can also bookmark the website link. The organizer is only accessible on a computer.
We recommend that you watch this helpful 4-minute tutorial prior to starting your organizer: 
https://www.iorad.com/player/2418254/Organizer-Client-Experience?iframeHash=watchsteps-1&src=iframe&oembed=1#watchsteps-1
For technical issues with your organizer see the Contact Person listed in the organizer.
Access Client Portal 
This email is an auto-generated message. Please do not reply. 
 
Powered by 
SafeSend

From:

n.barile@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Sunday, February 2, 2025 9:55 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Financial & Salary Review
 
Hi there.
Sorry for my delay on this.
Please see my comments below.
I'd be happy to talk through any of this as well.
Thanks!
 
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Friday, January 31, 2025 12:05 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Financial & Salary Review
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
I will not be available for tomorrows call and would like it to be repurposed.
 
Are we sticking with the financials SG sent today? Is this the final proposal? What are the issues left to discuss that weren’t on our last call? 
The last proposal is final. Also, FYI we are keeping Larry on for 2 more weeks, as that is the only way he would stay on to deliver some urgent commitments. Chuck has asked him also to engage in sales efforts during this time (reaching out to clients & contacts). [We do not need to update the cash flow predictor based on Larry's change due to other changes SG made to the doc].
 
I rather have all restructuring and budget finalized by you and Andrew can support. Both Chuck and I are not best for brainstorming cuts and financials. This is not the most eloquent email but I really want you to make the decisions and I do want Andrew to support you.
I want you and Andrew to talk through where else we can cut expenses (potentially outsourcing SG’s role and other roles that are currently $25-$30 an hour and how they can be replaced with lower cost). 
I have already modeled what this would look like if we replaced all PT roles. Right now, the impact is very small if we replace PT people. For ex, replacing Kaitlin saves about $450 per month. We will be replacing Catalina in 2 weeks with someone lower cost (likely $15/hr) - BTW, that only saves $600/mo. Keri's role will be eliminated shortly because we have Arvin. Sure, we could also replace Arvin, but not yet, since she's started on the ELs/MLs. We've reduced hours for Juri in the meantime & cannot yet pull her off BSC & GroupM. We can replace SG, but from what I understand, we have gone through so many accounting folks. Is it worth replacing her to find out, yet again, that the new person doesn't know what they are doing? 
That said, I will ask SG if she can lower her rates.
We spent over $500K last year on external expenses, so I would like a review of how else to cut costs. 
I've reviewed all of our external expenses. We already are doing everything we can to reduce these expenses - getting rid of smaller expenses, such as Bill.Com, Calendly, LinkedIn, WeWork, etc. We have also stopped or are stopping any larger expenses - Dustin, reducing what we pay translators, reducing what we pay external facilitators. I've already identified facilitators at $250/hr & am currently speaking to people like Hanadi about paying them half of what we have been paying them. Other high costs were for paying others for curriculum development - like Bright Carbon. We won't have those high costs this year. And of course there are the rather large legal, accounting, and financial consulting fees... 
Are those going to continue in 2025?
Which Aging AP should we stop paying immediately and not pay for the next 6-9 months, due to it not being essential going forward? Which AP should we continue to pay? 
I don't understand this. 
Are you asking that we don't pay people we owe money to? Or are you saying that we should not continue to work with some external folks....?
Reviewing Sales Strategy? KPIs? How is everyone focused on sales? (Catalina, RP, Andrea, Chuck, you, and I). Hopefully by May, with all of us focused on sales and workflow issues solved, we should pick up in revenue. 
Chuck & I are doing everything we can. Honestly, the KPI (goal) is to reach out to everyone you can & to repeat reaching out over and over again. I know Chuck is doing this, because we talk about it, and I can see his efforts in HubSpot. You cannot count on Andrea & RP to sell for us, but they are doing what they can to save existing business. That said, I can see (in HubSpot & she copies me on emails) that RP is following up with dormant clients & clients she is actively talking to. Chuck is leading LCW webinars. I am taking on all new inquiries and following up with everything in HubSpot Deals, whether inactive or not. I've reached out to every external consultant to offer the referral program.
 We are way better set up in HubSpot to engage with contacts & have an email campaign started as well as social media campaigns. Live events are scheduled & continue to be scheduled.
 
The thing missing here is that we have yet to speak at a conference. 
This is why it is crucial that you speak at 1 live event (not an LCW event) per month. It can be an interview, part of a panel, whatever. Just get in front of people & post about it on LinkedIn. 
Reach out to HR, DEI, Leadership, Global related groups & people who host webinars & live shows that are visible (shared on LinkedIn). You can try Hacking HR, SHRM, legal groups. Why not ask your friend who works at that law firm to be a speaker, for example...? 
I would also argue that you should go to any in-person networking events or speak at local conferences. 
I know we had Chuck slated to do this, but if he's leading 1-2 LCW live events per month, it becomes more difficult to also speak at other events. I will confirm with Chuck on this topic.
        
Once all of the above has been discussed and solved for, let’s have a cash injection plan and what its purpose would be. 
All above is solved for, in the process of being solved, or won't impact the financial cash injection plan.
 
I know that we have to make sure everyone is involved in sales activities, but I can assure you Chuck & I are doing whatever we can to save LCW. To be honest, the KPIs we created are just stabs in the dark (ex: Chuck need to generate 3 qualified leads per month). To share them weekly doesn't seem to be of much value. That said, I'm going to schedule a weekly sales call for us 3 to keep each other accountable. We can use this Tuesdays meeting to do that & then I will schedule something else going forward.
 
Would love to talk more on this when you've read through it. Thanks!
 
On my side, I contacted Wework, I will get final notice in the next few weeks approving the last month (most likely being Feb). I need to know we are as lean and smart with expenses as we can be and I trust you and Andrew to do that best. Honestly, over myself.  
 
Thanks,
 
Alisa

CSMO and Managing Partner

Thanks Chuck – and hello, Arvin!
 
If possible, the first thing we would need is a script to base the elearning off of. This could be (a) a transcription of a live session, if any of those have been saved/recorded, or (b) a compilation of the speaker notes from the course PPT. 
Chuck
, do you know if there is a [zoom] recording that Arvin can access to pull a transcription from? If not, then Arvin please do a quick “compilation” of slide notes from the deck and we will use that as our base to begin a rough design doc.
 
Thank you, both!
Cheers,
Randy

These are the in-person Spotlights that that we want to transition to elearnings. The question outstanding is about whether a Neurodiversity elearning module ends up being a single 30-40 minute module or a module made up of multiple 8-10 minute microlearnings.
 
You can work on the design document. We will have a SME provide you with feedback. Once we have that approved we can move to storyboarding.
 
I’ve attached a storyboard example from a previous elearning to illustrate what the team is used to. It DOES NOT mean you need to use this exact format but being able to see what will display on the screen, what will be narrated (from the instructor note in the deck), and any interactivity or content branches visually will help them provide you with feedback.
 
Again, you don’t have to use the format in the attached example, but the visual will help them once we get to that point.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.

From:
 Chuck Adams 
Sent:
 Friday, December 20, 2024 3:48 PM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Hello - Project Information
 
Namaste, Arvin – 
 
Checking to see if you got this email and to ensure you have access to the Dropbox folder for your work.
https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/vea07suyqdq3m4kog7kyt/AMRsqF6wDOgXx0R88JJVLQ8?rlkey=i5u3d907i7ows29hff6jvppii&st=w53pux9s&dl=0
 
You should have permissions to this folder. The Inbox will have the materials for you to work on. You’ll find a few files in there already. When finished you can put your output in the Outbox folder.
 
 
Let’s start with the Religious Inclusion micro-learning. I would like you to develop and share a design document for how you would build this as a 10-15 minute microlearning in Rise. Once we get past that one we can focus on the elearning transitions.
 
The classroom deck to elearning transitions will be competed as 30-35 minute modules in Storyline. It is okay to put additional information on a ‘Want to know More’ branch but the main branch should be 30-35 minutes. I will need design documents for each of the sessions to show the SME for review before we start programming.
 
The order of the transition will be:
Neurodiversity
Black Community
Women in Leadership
Generations
People with Disability 
 
I figure this will take a few weeks for design, review, development, testing. It will be a good place to start. Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Best,
 
Chuck
 
Please Note: Honoring the need for work/life balance, LCW will be closed for Winter Break from December 24 through January 1st. Happy Holidays to you and yours!
 
Chuck Adams

subject: New comment from Columbia College Chicago
body:
You have a new notification 
Hello Randall,
A staff member at 
Columbia College Chicago
 from Columbia College Chicago commented on 
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC (LCW)
 profile 
"Thank you for thinking of our creative Talent. Please adhere to the following criteria for posting to our Columbia College Chicago Career Portal. At Columbia College Chicago, our mission is to provide education in the arts, communications, design, and media fields within the context of an enlightened liberal education. Approval of your job and/or internship is contingent upon the following criteria:   We post opportunities that are strictly related to our majors and programs. Internship and job posting approvals are at the discretion of Columbia College Chicago and the Handshake network, which reserve the right to edit or refuse a prospective employers' job announcement for any reason. The college also reserves the right to refuse to post opportunities that it determines, in its sole discretion, are not consistent with the educational, professional and employment goals and mission of Columbia and it’s students.   The Career Center at Columbia College Chicago operates under an equal opportunity employment policy and therefore cannot ethically refer individual students or show preference like a traditional recruiting agency. Inclusion of an internship or job opportunity does not guarantee applicants, however we do our absolute best to promote your opportunity to our students and alumni. When contacting students for interviews, please allow some flexibility due to their class schedules.   We will not post opportunities that require the purchase of product(s) or a financial investment to be employed, mass spam/duplication of job descriptions, or positions that are strictly commission based. All posted opportunities are required to have a posted salary or an hourly wage equal to or greater than the federal or state minimum wage unless it is listed in part, as an approved internship by our Internship and Career Advisors. Internships must be supervised by someone with experience directly related to the internship role and responsibilities.   Remote working opportunities must be identified as such and include frequency of reporting and reporting structure. For internships, please view our Employers Guide to Internship and Best Practices: 
https://students.colum.edu/career-center/articles/internships/employer-internship-guide.html
 ***INTERNSHIPS MUST BE SUPERVISED BY SOMEONE WITH EXPERIENCE IN THE FIELD/INDUSTRY THE INTERN IS WORKING IN. Paid internships are preferred and more likely to receive applicants than non-paid. Remote internships must be identified as such with weekly check-ins with the supervisor. Students may not intern in personal residences. To view our majors and programs, please visit: 
https://www.colum.edu/academics/majors-and-programs.html
   Thank you "

IDI Platform Launches February 17th
We are excited to announce the new IDI Platform will be launching on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
The current IDI Assessment Website will be 
unavailable
 starting 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
. During the migration period, from February 12th-16th, you will not be able to access your IDI account or data. In addition, respondents will not be able to access the IDI Assessment during that time.
Your IDI data will be migrated to the new Platform and available in your account. If you would like any IDI results in the current report format, you should generate and download those reports no later than 
Tuesday, February 11, 2025
. After the launch, you will be able to generate and download IDI data in the new report format. You can see an example of the new IDI Profile Reports and Intercultural Development Plans (IDP) in your current QA Account under 
QA Resources - New IDI Platform Resources
.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser
Copyright (C) 2025 IDI, LLC. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Our mailing address is:
IDI, LLC 2915 Olney Sandy Spring Road Suite D Olney, MD 20832-3503 USA 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

subject: WP Engine Security_ Plugin Vulnerability Notification - Elementor Pro Plugin
body:
Hello,
At WP Engine we take the security of your sites very seriously, and make every effort to keep our customers aware of any potential security risks. We are reaching out to you today because we identified resources that may be utilizing a vulnerable version of the elementor-pro plugin.
The lcwdev on lcwweb is running version 3.6.2.
WP Engine summary of the vulnerability: Information useful to an attacker could be made available. Site configuration, user names, or email addresses are examples of information that could be revealed as a result of an information disclosure.
This vulnerability’s information has been verified by Patchstack. Please note that questions related to this notification should be directed to Patchstack, the plugin author or the 3rd-party researcher for the most accurate information.
Resources providing further information on this vulnerability:
https://patchstack.com/database/vulnerability/elementor-pro/wordpress-elementor-website-builder-pro-plugin-3-25-10-authenticated-contributor-sensitive-information-exposure-via-shortcode-vulnerability?_a_id=473
 
To secure your site, please upgrade to the latest version of this plugin.
We always suggest making a backup before making any changes. You can learn how to do this in this article: 
https://wpengine.com/support/restore/
.
Would you like to avoid doing these updates manually in the future? Add the Smart Plugin Manager: 
https://my.wpengine.com/products/smart_plugin_manager
 to your plan today!
Finally, feel free to reach out to our Support team if you need assistance with backing up or updating your website!
Thanks,
-WP Engine Security Team

Check-In:

Check-Out:

Pine Mountain Resort is committed to providing its guests and associates with a smoke-free environment. Our resort and all of our guest rooms are non-smoking. subject: Pedro Seminario Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on January 21st, 2025
body:
We've received your request to terminate Pedro Seminario on 01/21/2025. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what TriNet will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Pedro from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
COBRA: COBRA Complete is administering COBRA for Pedro Seminario. TriNet will send Pedro's information to COBRA Complete within 24 hours after the termination date. If you have any questions, please email COBRAComplete@healthaccountservices.com. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for NJ to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Pedro with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
TriNet
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Reimagining Culturally Resilient Initiatives Through the Power of Questions
body:
Register Now for Our April 9th Webinar! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Reimagining Culturally Resilient Initiatives Through the Power of Questions
 
 
 
 
April 9, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Questions drive innovation, and this webinar invites SIETAR USA members to explore how thoughtful inquiry shaped the adaptation of the Barnga intercultural communication simulation and the creation of the Culturally Resilient Card Deck. Consider the questions that fueled their creative processes—How can we recreate cultural immersion online? What tools enable resilience and understanding in diverse contexts? —as they transformed traditional methods into dynamic virtual experiences. Questioning plays a central role as participants learn how asking questions can uncover new possibilities and create meaningful, culturally rich learning environments. This session offers actionable insights emphasizing the importance of flexibility, cultural awareness, and creative design in fostering meaningful learning experiences that resonate across cultural and digital divides. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
NON-MEMBER REGISTRATION 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTERS:
 
Presenters
 
Dr. Terra Gargano serves as the Director of Faculty Development and Academic Affairs in the School of Education at Johns Hopkins University. Throughout her twenty-five-year career in higher education, she managed dozens of institutional collaborations worldwide, conducted workshops for faculty at domestic and international organizations, and learned alongside her students in the US and over a dozen countries. She taught English in Japan, serving as the Assistant Dean for Semester at Sea before joining the faculty at American University as the Program Director and Faculty Advisor for Online Programs in the School, with students logging into classes from over 15 time zones. She is a fierce Skee-Ball competitor and enjoys a good campfire story.  
Dr. Ed Timke, assistant professor in the Department of Advertising + PR at Michigan State University, is an expert in intercultural and global studies of media, with a focus on disability. He taught intercultural communication at American University’s School of International Service and held faculty positions at Duke University and the University of California, Berkeley. Through the International Student Exchange Programs, Ed taught English in a French high school and collaborated on international research projects. Living with a lifelong hearing disability, he advocates for accessibility and inclusion. When not spoiling six cats or trying to get home to the forests of the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, Ed enjoys “just one more coffee" and indulging his ultimate vice: The Golden Girls.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

>
Subject:
 RE: Ulteig HRBP Facilitation. 
 
My quick 2 cents:
 
First, it appears to be more of a “Decision Path for using the DIN” (as you try to rename it from “tree”)
 
Second, they aren’t 2 entirely separate steps in my opinion.  Imagine Laura falsifies expense reports to take home some extra cash, but she’s a wonderful facilitator. Is the outcome “net positive” in that case, if no one tells the client?  
 
My very quick rough draft of a decision path that I think may be helpful, at least at the beginning would be this:
 
I did this in like 20 minutes, so it is in no way pressure tested, vetted, or perfectly worded, structured, etc. Just an idea.  If the end result is Green, you’ll benefit from using the DIN.
 
It may be overly simply for some managers, but it highlights when the DIN will add more value.
 
So although I like the colors and graphic design below, the path itself is what needs to change in my opinion.
 
Thanks!
Randy
 
 
From:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
>

r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>; Larry Baker <

>
Subject:
 Ulteig HRBP Facilitation. 
 
Hi Randy.  How’s life in South America?  (
don’t answer that
!).  I wanted to share the draft presentation with you.  It includes the new tool we discussed.  Also, if you are free on Wednesday, I would welcome time to get your thoughts on the flow of the session.  We are delivering a little of what was done in 2023 with Senior Leaders (the DIN work).  That is the basis for the April manager session.  The HRBPs are going to get a preview of it later this month.
 
Let me know if/when you have time this week before Friday.  Thank you.
 
Cheers~
 
Andrea Wicks Bowles

Second, they aren’t 2 entirely separate steps in my opinion.  Imagine Laura falsifies expense reports to take home some extra cash, but she’s a wonderful facilitator. Is the outcome “net positive” in that case, if no one tells the client?  
 
My very quick rough draft of a decision path that I think may be helpful, at least at the beginning would be this:
 
I did this in like 20 minutes, so it is in no way pressure tested, vetted, or perfectly worded, structured, etc. Just an idea.  If the end result is Green, you’ll benefit from using the DIN.
 
It may be overly simply for some managers, but it highlights when the DIN will add more value.
 
So although I like the colors and graphic design below, the path itself is what needs to change in my opinion.
 
Thanks!
Randy

View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Wednesday Webinar registration is open!
'Im Navigating Toxicity: A Reflective Discussion on Sustaining Purpose Values, and Well-being in Intercultural and DEIB Work'
 
 
 
 
 
February 12, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
In this guided discussion and reflection session, participants will engage in meaningful conversations about the challenges of maintaining purpose, values, and well-being in today's often toxic cultural landscape. Through shared dialogue and self-reflective exercises, we'll explore intentions vs. impact, address experiences with micro-aggressions, and examine the role of self-awareness in navigating these spaces. This session offers space to share insights, reflect on personal experiences, and collaboratively identify strategies for sustaining our journey through intercultural and DElB work while prioritizing self-care and supporting others. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member Registration 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member Registration 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tiffany Young, M.Ed., has over 15 years of experience advancing diversity, equity, inclusion, cultural competency, student achievement, and community development. As the owner and principal consultant of
 
Tiffany Young Consulting, LLC
, 
her approach emphasizes embedding equity, diversity, inclusion, and cultural competency into every facet of schools, departments, and organizations. 
Since 2006, TIffany has been a Commissioner for the Nevada Equal Rights Commission (NERC) and the Peace Officer Standards and Training Commission. She is also recognized as a 
Fulbright Specialist
 with the 
U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs
. Internationally, Tiffany has facilitated transformative training programs in Zambia and Algeria, and collaborated with international programs such as the 
Mandela Washington Fellowship for Young African Leaders
, 
the
 
Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI)
, 
and the
 
Study of U.S. Institutes for Student Leaders (SUSI)
. 
Currently, Tiffany serves as the 
Program Director
 
for the
 
Department of Defense Youth STEM STARBASE High Sierra Program. 
 
Learn more about Tiffany's work at 
www.tiffanyyoungconsulting.org
.

We've received your request to terminate Sarah Nodarse on 01/31/2025. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what TriNet will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Sarah for termination in payroll on 
01/31/2025
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
COBRA: COBRA Complete is administering COBRA for Sarah Nodarse. TriNet will send Sarah's information to COBRA Complete within 24 hours after the termination date. If you have any questions, please email COBRAComplete@healthaccountservices.com. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for IL to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Sarah with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here

contact us.

subject: FW: Ulteig HRBP Facilitation.
body:
I like your path Randy. 
 
My two cents:
 
I’d change “Does it contradict organizational norms?” to “
Is the behavior in conflict with organizational norms?”
Have they been communicated clearly, 
in ways you’ve learned this person connects with?
In that same row, in the same green box where it says “Performance Discussion using the DIN” I would (1) reword to “
Development Discussion
” and (2) I’d also write a note underneath that says something like 
“Consider if organizational norm could be expanded to include different/varied styles”
 
I’d change “Does it contradict your personal/professional approach?” to “
Does it fall outside of performance expectations?”
YES 
à
 Development Discussion using the DIN.  
Consider if performance expectations may warrant additional development or time based on this person’s cultural background (equity).
  
 
NO
à
 “Is it in conflict with your work/communication approaches?” 
In that same row, in the same green box where it says “Performance Discussion using the DIN” I would reword to 
“Development Discussion”
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW

Sent:
 Thursday, January 9, 2025 10:00
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Application for Data Analyst Intern Position at LCW
 
Dear Randall,
I hope this message finds you well. My name is Shubham Jain, and I am reaching out to express my interest in the Data Analyst Intern position at Language & Culture Worldwide (LCW). I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to LCW’s mission of promoting inclusion and equity in the workplace.
Currently, I am pursuing a master's degree in Data Science at the University at Buffalo. I have hands-on experience in data analysis, having worked on multiple projects where I utilized tools like SQL, Python, and Excel to collect, clean, and analyze data to extract meaningful insights. Additionally, I am proficient in using Tableau and Power BI for data visualization and have experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
My previous work as a Data Scientist Intern and Python Full Stack Developer has further honed my ability to automate data processes, optimize workflows, and provide actionable insights. I have a solid understanding of business analytics, data profiling, and data integration, all of which are essential for this internship role.
I am passionate about contributing to diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and I believe my analytical skills, attention to detail, and commitment to continuous learning make me a great fit for this role.
Please find my resume attached for more information. I look forward to the possibility of contributing to LCW’s impactful work.
Thank you for considering my application.
Best regards,
Shubham Jain

subject: The Winter 2025 University of Chicago Magazine
body:
Preview the new issue of the Magazine. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
 
 
Dear Reader,
 
As you wind your way through the Winter issue of the 
Magazine
, I hope you’ll spend some time with “The Longest Route,” an essay by College alumna Mary Quade, AB’93. Quade’s meditation on Route 20, which passes near her Ohio home as it traverses the country from Massachusetts to Oregon, made me think about traveling and destinations, and the minor fall—the journey’s end—that can come with the major lift of arriving somewhere.
 
Route 20 has become a slower means of getting from point A to point B than it once was; or rather, other means, like the interstates, have gotten faster. Quade writes about how Route 20 loses its identity for a stretch in Yellowstone National Park, becoming an unnumbered park road where taking your time is enforced, even celebrated.
 
I haven’t been to Yellowstone, but in northern Michigan I love the Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive, where you can pay $25 for the privilege of driving 7.4 miles at no more than 20 miles per hour.
 
Twenty miles per hour is relative. Some drivers treat the speed limit as just a suggestion, pushing 30 in pursuit of the memorable scenic overlook along the way. Others treat it as a different kind of suggestion, embracing the journey to the tune of 10 or 15 miles per hour, pulling over as needed to let the vista seekers pass.
 
Maybe you read the 
Magazine
 with a destination in mind, or maybe you like to see what you see along the way. Whatever your chosen path, we always want to hear what catches your attention.
 
Thank you for reading!
 
Best wishes,
 
 
 
Laura Demanski, AM’94
Editor
 
P.S. Be sure to add me to your address book so that you’ll keep receiving the quarterly 
UChicago Magazine Prepress Edition
. And remember, we always appreciate hearing what readers want, so drop me a line anytime.
 
 
 
Read the Winter/25 issue:
 
•
 
Learn about UChicago’s new Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth.
•
 
Read an excerpt from retired federal judge David S. Tatel’s (JD’66) memoir about how losing his vision affected his life and career.
•
 
Discover an exhibition at the Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center highlighting women’s contributions to printing.
•
 
Explore Route 20 and points along the way in Mary Quade’s essay.
•
 
… Plus more UChicago stories.
 
 
Read the Winter/25 issue’s
 
Alumni News
.
Read
 
back issues
 
of the 
Magazine
.
Contact
 
the 
Magazine
.
 
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago
5801 South Ellis Avenue
Chicago, IL 60637
1.800.955.0065
 
 
This University of Chicago Magazine Digital Edition email was sent to randall@lcwmail.com.
If you no longer wish to receive these emails, you may 
update your communication preferences
 at any time.

subject: Do you want to be on Board?
body:
Open Call for board positions
 
 
 
Are you on board?
January, 2025
 
 
 
 
 
Dear Randall,
The Young SIETAR board is not yet fully complete and we are waiting on YOU to join!
 
There are four open board positions: President, Secretary, Treasurer, and Mentorship / Membership Coordinator.
We'd like to encourage you to consider running for one of the positions. All positions are volunteer, require those who hold the positions to be an active member of Young SIETAR or are willing to join, and finally require a certain level of mentoring and management in the beginning. 
Please announce your candidacy to the board by February 1st, 2025 (earlier would be highly appreciated). We would like you to be able to present yourself to the membership during the general assembly in March, 2025.
 
 
Learn more about the specific positions here: 
President Job description
Secretary Job description
Treasurer job description
Membership / mentoring job description
 
Send your questions, CV, and motivation letter to 
board@youngsietar.org
.
 
We look forward to hearing from you and to you joining our team. 
Interculturally yours,
The Young SIETAR Board
 (Veronique, Chelmy, Comi, Lucrezia, and Christina)
 
 
Follow us on Instagram
 | 
Find us on Facebook
 | 
Find us on LinkedIn
 
Copyright © 2025 Young SIETAR. All rights reserved.
Contact email: 
board@youngsietar.org

subject: Everything you need to know about Kenvue’s transition
body:
Click here for 
Chinese
, 
Dutch
, 
French
, 
German
, 
Italian
, 
Japanese
, 
Portuguese
, 
Spanish
Dear Valued Supplier,
 
Over the course of 2024, we’ve been in regular contact to share with you details about the operational changes we are making to establish Kenvue as an independent company and to make working with us more efficient and impactful.
Implementation of these changes has run smoothly to date, and we want to thank those of you who have already been onboarded to our new ways of working for your co-operation. Our transitions continue on a region-by-region basis.
 
 
An overview of all our changes
 
 
We’re launching new platforms for eSourcing and Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM)
To make working with us quicker and easier, we are centralizing our sourcing activities using the eSourcing platform, Keelvar, and transitioning our CLM processes to Malbek. 
 
We have a new Kenvue ID in Ariba
If you do not use Ariba, you will continue to receive your Purchase Orders (POs) via email.
If you do use Ariba, we will transition to a new Kenvue ID. You will receive an email from SAP Ariba asking you to accept a new trading relationship request (TRR). Please make sure to accept the TRR in order to continue transacting with Kenvue Ariba.
 
Supplier catalogs will need to transition to the new Kenvue environment
Suppliers with Ariba catalogs will — where applicable — be asked to re-upload the list of products or services you offer to Kenvue into our new profile. We will notify you when you need to take this action. In the meantime, please make sure your Ariba expert and IT team are prepared for the changes. 
 
You can expect some changes to purchase orders (POs)
There will be some changes to purchase orders depending on whether you are a Direct or Indirect supplier.
All Indirect POs that remain open at the time of the transition will be closed and Kenvue will create replacement POs for the remaining balance with a new PO number in the new system.  
Direct POs will retain the same PO number.  
 
The way you submit invoices to us will change too
Some of our current invoicing platforms will change. The existing J&J portal, GSX, and Ariba invoicing module will no longer be available for Kenvue suppliers once your local transition is complete. We will, however, offer new options to our suppliers for submitting invoices.
One of these options in some countries will be Tungsten’s e-invoicing solution.  Tungsten offers a simple and easy way to submit your invoices, with a one-time set up and invoice submission support.
 
A temporary pause will be placed on payments
Payments will pause for a short period during the transition period.
 
We’re launching a new supplier support number
We have set up a new helpdesk support number for all our suppliers.
 
Suppliers will also gain access to a new supplier portal
All suppliers can use this portal to access a new live chat service. Some suppliers will also be able to use the portal to access accounts payable functions, giving them the ability to submit and reply to support tickets, access knowledge articles and policies, view a purchase order status, track invoices and payments, complete supplier onboarding, and manage supplier accounts. Once the portal goes live in your region, you will receive an automated email from ‘Kenvue AP Portal’ that will include instructions on how to register.
 
We are changing our company name in some countries
We are also taking the opportunity to update our company name in some countries and will be asking you to reflect this change in your systems too. You will receive a separate email containing information specific to your region or country at key milestones, including 30 days prior to the transition.  
 
Our policies and terms and conditions (T&Cs) remain unchanged
 
We want to reassure you that this transition will have no impact on Kenvue’s existing policies. Kenvue’s standard T&Cs will now be 
found on our website
. 
 
We’re here for you
We understand that change can create disruption to ways of working and we want to support you throughout this process. We encourage you to reach out to your Kenvue contact for any other queries you may have.
 
Once again, we thank you for your collaboration and look forward to growing with you.
 
 
Best regards,
Kenvue Procurement

subject: [Important] Your 4th Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by January 08, 2025 for $0.02 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
Tax Payments report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
TriNet

help.zenefits.com
.

body:
Register now: Immersive Learning with the DREAM Framework ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Dear Randy,
Kickstart your year with our first webinar of 2025.
Webinar
'Immersive Learning with the DREAM Framework'
 
 
 
 
January 8, 2025 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Immersive learning experiences engage learners emotionally and therefore leave longer-lasting memories. According to the American neuro-economist Paul Zak, immersion is "a neurologic state in which one is attentive to an experience and it resonates emotionally." How can we make learning more immersive?
Bernd Gibson’s DREAM Framework provides the five main elements to turn learning into an immersive experience: Drama, Relations, Emotion, Action and Meaning.
In this interactive webinar, Bernd will take participants into the world of Learning Experience Design in an intercultural context. Attendees will playfully engage with these five elements to create their own DREAM experience.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER
Bernd Gibson
 is a Learning Experience Designer in the intercultural field based in France. ’The Immersive Theatre of Learning’, published in 2024, is his first book. In his work, Bernd combines elements of immersive theatre, improvisation, stage design and story to create powerful learning ensembles.
 
 
 
PRESENTER
Bernd Gibson
 is a Learning Experience Designer in the intercultural field based in France. ’The Immersive Theatre of Learning’, published in 2024, is his first book. In his work, Bernd combines elements of immersive theatre, improvisation, stage design and story to create powerful learning ensembles.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member Registration 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member Registration

4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

subject: µChicago: Trusting the gut
body:
µChicago, a monthly science newsletter. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
December 2024
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Trusting the gut
 
 
 
 
 
The trillions of microbes in your gut not only aid digestion but also influence immunity, metabolism, allergies, and even neurological health. For nearly 25 years, UChicago scientists have been leading research to uncover the complexity of the microbiome with an eye toward assessing and restoring its function.
 
 
 
 
 
Master of the microbiome
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Eugene Chang, MD’76, is credited with jump-starting a wave of microbiome research at the University of Chicago. (Photography by Nancy Wong)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
While studying inflammatory bowel diseases, Eugene Chang, MD’76, Martin Boyer Professor of Medicine, hypothesized that the conditions were linked to the gut microbiome—a theory that, almost 25 years later, has sparked 
a field of research
 into this complex ecosystem of trillions of microbes. Researchers at UChicago have identified how certain microbes produce metabolites (small molecules that travel through the bloodstream) that affect immune function, metabolism, and disease progression, revealing links between the microbiome and diabetes, liver disease, allergies, immune disorders, and neurodevelopmental conditions. This research is bolstered by advanced technology at places such as a 
new facility
 at the Duchossois Family Institute that can manufacture microbiome therapeutics for personalized and precise treatments. 
 
 
 
 
 
Learn more about the importance of gut health in a 
2023 
Big Brains
 podcast episode
 with UChicago experts.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Gutting-edge discoveries
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
 
 
 
 
 
Brain–gut connection: 
Two UChicago mouse studies
 link Alzheimer’s, estrogen levels, and the gut microbiome, prompting further research on how they are related and the implications for disease treatment.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2
 
 
 
 
 
Microbial missteps: Antimicrobial compounds used as food preservatives can 
harm beneficial gut bacteria
 while killing pathogens. UChicago researchers aim to harness these compounds’ protective properties while minimizing negative effects on gut health.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
3
 
 
 
 
 
AI twin: A 
new artificial intelligence tool
 creates a “digital twin” of the infant gut microbiome to predict microbial dynamics and identify risk for cognitive deficits, potentially enabling personalized intervention strategies.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
4
 
 
 
 
 
No oxygen, no problem: Certain bacteria use a 
wide array of metabolites
 as energy sources in the oxygen-free gut environment, producing compounds that act like natural drugs.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Spotlight
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A cryptic hitchhiker
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UChicago scientists are beginning to understand the “cryptic” plasmid pBI143, but there are still many unanswered questions about it. (
iStock.com/image_jungle
)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A team of current and former UChicago researchers have discovered a plasmid, or a circular piece of DNA, that is abundant in the microbiome of individuals from industrialized areas of the world. Known as 
pBI143
 and initially identified by Emily Fogarty, PhD’23, this type of plasmid is called cryptic by microbiologists as it manages to survive without providing any obvious benefit to its bacterial hosts. This genetic “hitchhiker” rapidly transfers between bacterial species, at times behaving like a parasite—but the researchers theorize that it may at other times pick up extra genes that benefit its hosts. Its prevalence within specific microbiomes, including those of inflammatory bowel disease patients, highlights its potential as a marker for microbial stress and its role within the “core microbiome” of certain populations. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In case you missed it
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
New institute to confront climate change:

subject: Protect your site and save time with Smart Plugin Manager
body:
Save time and secure your site with automated plugin updates and Visual Regression Testing, exclusive to Smart Plugin Manager.
 
Safe, automated plugin and theme updates for your site 
Secure and automate updates with Smart Plugin Manager, featuring Visual Regression Testing.
Learn More 
 
Out-of-date plugins account for over 50% of security risks on WordPress sites, leading to time-consuming and risky manual updates. These updates can potentially break your site and frustrate visitors.
That’s why we created 
Smart Plugin Manager
-- an automated solution that takes the hassle out of updates while ensuring your site stays secure. With Smart Plugin Manager, you can schedule updates at times that suit your business and monitor all your plugins from a centralized view, keeping your site protected and running smoothly.
Add Smart Plugin Manager 
What sets Smart Plugin Manager apart? 
 
Visual Regression Testing 
Carefully examines your site’s appearance before and after updates to ensure everything looks as it should.
 
Auto-Rollback and Restore 
If an update causes issues, your site is automatically rolled back, ensuring it’s not left in a broken state.
 
Pre-Update Backups 
A full site backup is taken before updates run, giving you peace of mind.
 
Customizable Updates 
Choose which plugins and themes to auto-update and which to skip.
 
Set Your Schedule 
Schedule updates during low-traffic times to avoid disruptions.
Take human error out of the equation. Let 
Smart Plugin Manager
 handle your plugin updates, saving you time and effort.
Visit your WP Engine User Portal to learn more and activate it for your site.
Add Smart Plugin Manager 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St., Suite 1000, Austin,TX
Manage Preferences
Legal disclaimer

subject: Keri Luo Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on December 31st, 2024
body:
We've received your request to terminate Keri Luo on 12/31/2024. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what TriNet will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Keri for termination in payroll on 
12/31/2024
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for IL to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Keri with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
TriNet
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.
