subject: Together We Made 2024 Unforgettable
body:
Your growth is our priority as we celebrate 2024 accomplishments and plan the future together.
 
Dear WP Engine Customers and Community,
As we approach the end of 2024, we want to take a moment to say thank you. Your trust and partnership mean the world to us, and your success fuels our passion to live up to WP Engine’s promise: 
powering the freedom to create.
This year has been one for the books—marked by challenges that sparked opportunities, and moments of growth that deepened our connection with you. Whether you’ve been with us for years or recently joined the WP Engine family, we’re honored to be part of your journey.
Here are just a few highlights from 2024 that showcase how we’ve doubled down on supporting your success and pushing the limits of what’s possible with WordPress.
Expertise You Can Count On 
We’ve broadened our expertise in WordPress trends and use cases and deepened our knowledge center to help you stay ahead in the ever-evolving world of WordPress.
 
Headless study 
Our WordPress trend reports, like this year’s 
headless study
, provided actionable insights for pushing boundaries.
 
Say 'Hi!' to Willa 
We introduced Willa, our conversational chatbot, to make accessing support even faster and easier.
 
24/7 expert support 
Around the clock, our 24/7 expert support team continues to deliver high-touch experiences, maintaining a CSAT score of 96% worldwide.
Innovation at the Core 
This year, we delivered numerous product updates to make building, managing, and optimizing your WordPress sites even more seamless and powerful.
 
 
ACF 
With over 25 updates to 
Advanced Custom Fields
, we’ve kept this beloved tool original, secure, and evolving.
 
 
Nitropack 
The addition of NitroPack
 brought unparalleled page speed optimization to our platform.
 
AI Optimization 
AI is now woven into your site optimization arsenal, simplifying complex search tasks with smarter, more relevant results.
 
 
Dark Mode 
New features like Dark Mode, SSL Management, and Copy Site Improvements made your tools more intuitive and efficient.
People-First and Community-Centered 
Our roots in the open-source WordPress community drive everything we do, and this year we’ve strengthened that connection even further.
DE{CODE} 2024 
Over 10,000 attendees joined us for 
DECODE 2024
, our largest virtual event to date. We can’t wait to share more in the new year.
 
Agency Partners 
With over 11,000 
agency partners
 now part of our community, we’re proud to champion the builders shaping the future of the web.
A wealth of resources like our 
case studies
, 
support resources
, and 
builder how-tos
 are updated daily, curated by our dedicated developer relations and support teams. 
Uncompromising Performance 
Lastly, we’ve kept the powerful engine running behind the scenes so that your performance remains uncompromised through the highs and lows. This is what our platform facilitated every day in 2024:
 
5B+ 
global platform requests processed
70M+ 
cyber attacks blocked yearly by our security
8% 
of people online visit a website on WP Engine
Read the full blog article  
 
Thank You! 
None of this would be possible without you. Thank you for letting us be part of your story and for inspiring us to do more. In 2025, we want to hear from you even more as we continue shaping the future of WordPress—and the web itself—together. Here’s to a new year filled with creativity, solidarity, innovation, and growth.
With gratitude,
The WP Engine Team
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St., Suite 1000, Austin,TX 78701

Dear Friend of the University,
 
Last month, we invited you to participate in a survey about your experience as a valued member of the University of Chicago community.
 
We’ve been thrilled by the participation so far, and we hope you’ll take a moment to add your voice. Alumni and supporters like you are vital to the University’s mission, and your perspective will help us foster a stronger, more vibrant community.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Take the survey »
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The survey should take about 15 minutes to complete, and we will be collecting responses through December 31. The link above is unique to you and can be used only once. If you’ve already started the survey, the link will let you pick up where you left off.

subject: Thoughts From the MindTaming Blog
body:
Musings and Meditations on Mindfulness
 
 
December 2024
Welcome to Issue No. 12 of MindTaming!
 
 
 
On My Mind:
 
Eight Daily Practices for an Interesting Year Ahead
 
Dear Friends,
2024 has been a tough year for many of us, on both a societal-global and an individual-personal level. Continued warfare in Ukraine and Gaza and other places in the world, the increasing impact of the climate crisis, a US election outcome that left many of us despairing and… and… and.
On a personal level, I had a bike accident in August (I am happy to report that I am 95% recovered with the help of excellent physiotherapists – much gratitude!) and various smaller mishaps. Also, three friends lost their partners rather unexpectedly, which reminded me of how limited time with our loved ones can be and that loss is part of the circle of life. 
These events have kept me wondering what I am to learn – so much so that a part of me wants to “put this year behind me,” hoping that 2025 will bring less upheaval and more peace and calmness. 
AND: I am a mindfulness practitioner, so I know that’s not how it works. Rather than “putting things behind me,” I need to do the opposite: stay with whatever comes up and return to the practice again and again – with a beginner’s mind. 
One thing I have gotten better at is noticing the “second arrow” and stopping it from hitting me! The second arrow is a Buddhist concept that when a bad event happens, there are two “arrows,” or sources of pain. The first arrow is the event itself, and the second arrow is our reaction to the event. The second arrow is avoidable because we can choose how to react. 
As far as next year goes (or NOW, for that matter), my intention is to focus on these daily practices and make them my go-to’s:
1.
    
Express gratitude and show appreciation.
2.
    
Be kind and generous even (especially) when I want to do the opposite.
3.
    
Cultivate community and tend to my relationships.
4.
    
Meditate and spend time in nature.
5.
    
Reduce my news intake and screen time while staying informed.
6.
    
Show compassion to myself and others. 
7.
    
Include moments and periods of rest and recharge.
8.
    
Find joy in small things.
I might even start painting again. I purchased a watercolor set last weekend and plan to add to my small collection of watercolor paintings I created when I was in my 20s. 
What are you going to do to get ready for the new year? Let me know your ideas, and I will create a list of “survival skills for uncertain times” to share in my next blog. 
With deep gratitude to all of my readers – friends, family, colleagues and clients – and to my teachers. May all of you find many moments of peace, joy and inspiration during this transition to 2025 and throughout the new year.
Rita
 
 
Community: Offerings for Practicing in Community
Interested in meditating in community? Join our Midweek Mindfulness Meditation (MMM) Sangha.
Wednesdays from 12-12:30pm EST
Free online meditation practice including a guided reflection and a 15-minute silent sit. Open to anyone who is interested in practicing mindfulness meditation in community. If you’d like to receive a weekly reminder to participate, sign up 
here
. 
Growing Your Mindfulness Practice: A four-week course for beginners and other people interested in learning (more) about mindfulness
Thursdays, February 6,13, 20 & 27, 2025, 
from 8-9:15pm EST
This four-week online course offers participants an introduction to the practice of mindfulness in four interactive online sessions via Zoom. Each session focuses on a particular aspect of mindfulness including mindfulness of the body, mindfulness of emotions and mindfulness of thoughts.
To sign up, click 
here
.
 
Cool Resource
s
The Serviceberry: Abundance and Reciprocity in the Natural World
 
by Robin Wall Kimmerer
The acclaimed botanist, author and winner of a MacArthur Foundation Genius Grant offers a “bold and inspiring vision for how to orient our lives around gratitude, reciprocity, and community based on the lessons of the natural world.” 
I have been obsessed with Robin Wall Kimmerer’s writing and thinking since I read her book “Braiding Sweetgrass.” This much smaller volume offers new and, in some ways, radical perspectives on how to learn from the natural world and make our “human” world a better one.
﻿
Dr. Rick Hanson
A shout-out to Dr. Rick Hanson, who is one of the meditation teachers I follow and whose offerings I find very accessible and helpful. He publishes a weekly newsletter called “Just One Thing” where he offers a short lesson or new perspective on a topic related to mindfulness and to leading a more intentional life. He also offers courses,
writings and free weekly meditations.
 
Click here to read  previous posts
 
 
 
Want to bring mindfulness to your workplace?
If you or your organization are interested in bringing mindfulness to your workplace and would like to discuss what that might look like, please 
contact me
 - and we'll set up an initial (no-obligation) meeting.
 
 
Tell me what you think!
I welcome any comment or question about anything mentioned in this blog. Email me at
 
rwuebbeler@interglobeweb.net
. If you do not want to continue to receive this blog click the Unsubscribe link below and uncheck MindTaming. To 
subscribe 
please 
email

﻿

subject: YS Winter Newsletter
body:
Closing out 2024 - Embracing Authenticity and New Possibilities for 2025!"
 
View this email in your browser
Winter Newsletter
Let’s welcome sweater weather together!
 
Showing gratitude
Since we in the global North are now knee-deep in December. For many, this is a time of reflection and gratitude. We are no different here at Young SIETAR. 
For that reason we would like to thank our 
Board of Inspiration
 for their continued support of our rag-tag group of young-at-heart interculturalists. We look forward to your continued expertise, guidance, and future collaborations. 
 
Research Reflections on 2024
As 2024 comes to an end, the intercultural field celebrates a year of profound growth and collaboration. In a world shaped by VUCA (volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity) and the acclerating impact of AI, Young SIETAR members and professionals worldwide have embraced the challenge of deepening intercultural understanding. 
This year brought forward communication frameworks, including the 
TRIPS Toolkit 
by Dr. Helen Spencer-Oatey, the revitalized 
TOPOI model 
by Dr. Edwin Hoffman, and 
AI-Enhanced Transcultural Communication models
. These tools remind us of the wisdom at the heart of intercultural work: that empathy, dialogue, and shared humanity remain our most powerful guides. 
As we reflect on 2024, may we find inspiration in the small yet profound steps that bring cultures closer, envisioning a future defined by connection, curiosity, and mutual respect.
Like this?  Read our Research Coordinator`s full reflection on the year on our website.
Website
*Clicking on the link will take you to our website & require you to log in as a member. 
 
Past events
Personality. Self-expression. Individuality. Creativity.
These were the key themes of the webinar we hosted with Jin Luo, an expert in personal branding and coaching. During the session, titled 
Personal Branding for Interculturalists
, Jin shared her journey of self-awareness and how embracing her multifaceted identity became the foundation of her success.
Being honest and true to ourselves is the cornerstone of personal branding. Each of us is an individual with multiple dimensions, and we should not limit these to fit into a specific context. Instead, breaking the rules and pushing boundaries allows us to unleash our potential and showcase our unique value.
Her story was an inspiration for aspiring entrepreneurs. 
The key takeaway? 
Unleash your creativity and be unapologetically yourself!
 
Upcoming events
Our board is busy planning events into 2025. 
As a little teaser, we hope to begin a new series of trainings/ webinars 
Think Intercultural
 
to help both those new to the intercultural field and seasoned professionals.
However, we hope to also be offering an insightful webinar toward the quiet end of January on 
Global Coaching
. 
Our next 
General Assembly
 (GA) will take place on 2nd, March 2025. During this digital event we will review our accomplishments, projects, research  and financial outlook from 2024, and our goals for 2025. It is a members-only event.
Finally, we are beginning to put together a team to plan our next 
Train-the-Intercultural-Trainer
 
(TOIT)
 program to take place in late 2025 or early 2026. 
More information coming soon. 
 
Looking for new board members
This past spring we welcomed three new volunteer board members to our team. However, many of you know that our board is still incomplete. We are now looking for a new 
president, secretary, treasurer, and membership coordinator
.
These are some big positions to fill so if you or someone you may know might be interested in any of these positions, we do request a 
CV and inspiration letter
. 
Additionally, we also request a period of transition which will include mentoring and management to ensure these positions are a great fit for everyone (the new candidates and the existing board). 
We will send out a separate email and post across social media about these positions soon.
Deadline for applications is 1st February, 2025
.
Positions will be voted in during our next 
General Assembly in March, 2024. 
To the blog post
*Clicking on the link will take you to our website & require you to log in as a member. 
 
Want more?
If you are already a member go over to our website to read about our upcoming events, view past webinars, learn about key research in the intercultural field, and so much more. 
We are updating our members only space all the time. 
If you are not yet a member, please consider becoming one. 
Join Us
 
And finally, before we leave you today our team would like to wish you a happy holiday season, however you celebrate (or not) this time of year. 
youngsietar.org
Copyright (C) 2024 Young SIETAR. All rights reserved.

subject: Sleepwalking into Conflict
body:
Hi Randall!
 
Attached and below please find our latest piece in which we explore not necessarily what Trump is going to do with China but more so how will China respond. We argue that there are about even odds for reform or more dishes getting thrown around the kitchen. 
 
Regards,
 
Francis
 
Francis Bassolino
Mobile: +1.843.427.0709
Mobile: +86.138.1650.4858
www.alarisconsultinggroup.com
 
francis_bassolino@alaris.com.cn
 
 
 
Sleepwalking into Conflict
There is a common misperception that Trump 2.0 will make a significant impact on the US-China relationship. But with bipartisan agreement that China is an adversary, the US is on a clear trajectory to confront China regardless of who is president. Indeed, even outside of Washington, there is virtually unanimous agreement to diversify, derisk if not decouple, and reduce dependency on China supply chains. Having said that, Trump 2.0 could be a catalyst for change. The question is not what Trump does, but how does China respond?
In 2016, Trump changed the debate on China from engagement to confrontation. Trump will greet China with urgent and vigorous demands for market access and reciprocity. If he doesn’t see immediate results, he will add pressure and temperature to make everyone uncomfortable with the status quo. He telegraphed as much during the campaign, and his guiding principles have not changed much over the 30 years that he has been dealing with China. Notwithstanding his chaotic antics and rhetoric, there is a method to his madness. 
Trump is trying to negotiate with China but to date China has shown little interest or urgency to address the substantial commercial and security issues that divide the US and China.
 
The Guiding Framework
In January 2020, after 3 years of negotiations, Trump signed the Phase 1 Trade Agreement with China. Trump will point to the lack of progress against commitments made in Phase 1, and then set even more aggressive goals which will reference Phase 2 drafts, WTO agreements, trade balances and security. 
Some pundits
[1]
 claim China can’t buy any more soybeans and airplanes. Others snigger that US customers will pay the tariffs Trump is so fond of. But such perspectives, besides thinly veiling contempt for Trump, miss the point and ignore the clear objectives of the US position. 
Trump is looking to:
Protect intellectual property
Remove forced technology transfers
Increase exports
Expand services access (Financial mostly)
Enhance dispute resolution
Improve data and cyber security
Remove subsidies
Improve market access
Reciprocity
 
The main focus is an expansion of 
trade in services
 (not goods) as well as protection and payment of intangibles and intellectual property. US exports of goods to China are not nearly as important as services. Moreover, most US and European companies already produce in China and what these companies need and want is fair market access and regulatory clarity. 
Another significant cause of disagreement that Trump will reference is that China continues to breach commitments that go as far back to its accession to the WTO in 2003. The latest United States Trade Representative report on China’s progress on WTO commitments contains a thorough list of continued non-compliance such as blocking 10,000 websites
[2]
. The primary issues of this report are:
China's WTO Membership: 
China is a state-directed and non-market-oriented market in contradiction to WTO membership principles.
Non-Market Policies: 
China employs a range of non-market policies and practices aimed at dominating global markets, causing harm to workers, businesses, and industries worldwide.
Challenges to Trading System: 
China's policies pose significant challenges to the international trading system, including state control over key industries, substantial subsidies, discriminatory regulations, and market access restrictions.
U.S. Trade Policy: 
The U.S. has adopted a multi-faceted strategy to address these challenges, including domestic investment, bilateral engagement, enforcement actions, and cooperation with allies.
Trump is trying to reset a relationship that has been off kilter since at least 2008 when China began to push mercantilist objectives counter to free trade commitments. 
Please go pound sand
US calls for market access and reciprocity have been met with the battle cry from wolf warriors that 
“China is rising, and the West is in decline”
. China seems blinded by a hubristic belief and its own propaganda that the US is not serious or capable of confronting China. 
Remarkably, Chinese diplomats claim that China is a protector of free trade, but the US and European community has been making more frequent and loud complaints that China’s markets are clearly far from open to non-native firms. Trump looks poised to flip the table, acting in ways that earlier US administrations would consider impolite or too painful to consider. 
Oddly, China seems oblivious or unwilling to accept the change in disposition and continues to play the divide and conquer strategy which has worked well for them over the past few decades. It continues to use deft strategies such as lobbying business leaders who are “paid” with market access or punishes those that talk back. It courts any constituents that tend to receive help from a trade, investment or security relationship with China. 
The wedge that wasn’t
It 2016, China tried to exploit the general dislike of Trump in Europe. But this divide and rule ploy has mostly failed as the conflict in Ukraine has strengthened the alliance. European views on China have hardened mostly because China is allied with an existential threat to European peace and security. Moreover, Chinese solar, EV and chemicals companies are now seen as mortal threats to these European industries. 
Within the EU, only Hungary and Turkey are overtly pro-China as these are destinations for large Chinese FDI. The leading European economies are unlikely to warm to China unless its bromance with Russia cools. Rather than discuss cooperation, many Europeans start conversations with complaints about anti-dumping and the arming of Russia.
Anti-dumping is now a common complaint outside the top five claimants against China, including the US, EU, Japan, Argentina and India. The next ten anti-dumping claimants include 
Australia, Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Indonesia, Israel, Jamaica, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Pakistan, Peru, and the Philippines.
The rematch: Trump vs. China 
The new Trump administration looks much stronger and certainly more experienced than 2016. Once again, Republicans control Congress, and the incoming team include many of the same people that wrote the Phase 2 documents which have already been drafted and circulated. Trump’s gun is locked and loaded. And he is motivated to generate real and optical wins. 
Conversely, China doesn’t seem to be in a hurry to change course or cooperate. Regardless of a faltering economy, China seems likely to punch back as we saw with the export restrictions on rare earths and publishing of “enemies lists”. 
But its situation is weaker than the last time these two teams met. China is battling debt, deflation, depopulation and even a wholesale depression of animal spirits and consumer sentiment. International investor interest is at an all-time low. 
Chinese supply chains absorbed as much as 70% of the cost increases due to the tariff hikes in Trump 1.0. Industries consolidated and efficiencies at factories improved mostly due to automation. Subsidies and currency depreciation also helped. But more tariffs will be difficult for many of the suppliers to absorb.
Getting Restless
The domestic political and macroeconomic dynamics put China on shaky ground. And the real wildcard on the horizon is how do Chinese citizens answer the question: 
“Is my life getting better?"
 More and more might say (anonymously) that the administration is on the wrong track or at least driving poorly. This is particularly true for middle to upper income households in first-tier cities. Most of these folks are concerned that the economy is on a trajectory that leads to decline in the quality of life if not for them at least for their children.
Domestic politics are not as neat and contained as many believe. While most of us have no access to the inner sanctum of the CCP, history teaches us that even the most powerful leaders are not uncontested when a country veers from ditch to ditch, economically and socio-politically. Socioeconomic stresses continue to build, and it appears that we are heading to a fork in the road with reform down one path and expanding state control down the other. 
Reform not war
We are not so bold as to predict a sudden change in leadership, but it seems probable that there is a growing constituency that is lobbying for significant changes to economic policy, something akin to what took place in the nineties where the state exited many industries and regulatory constraints were removed on businesses more broadly. 
Reform is probable given the historical precedence for reforms to stimulate the economy and release the stresses of dysfunctional socioeconomics. With China’s existing infrastructure, high savings rate and talented work force, reform –especially SOE privatization—could trigger another 20-year boom. Conversely, confrontation with the US portends more uncertain outcomes and this is why the CCP leadership may come to the view that war is not the answer.
Catalysts and questions
Over the course of the next few years the questions that we will be tracking include: Does the Chinese economy continue to falter? Does a new leader and or set of reforms emerge? How is Ukraine resolved, assuming it gets resolved? How does the dance in the Middle East play out? And finally, how much more salami will the Chinese try to cut in the south China seas and around Taiwan before the US and their allies get indigestion?
Geopolitical dynamics matter, but the primary question with the Sino-US relationship boils down to something quite straightforward. Namely, 
Is China willing to open its markets to areas where the US leads? 
Or more pointedly,
 Will China continue to delay Phase 1 commitments and lack urgency on Phase 2 negotiations as well as the WTO commitments?
 The answers to these questions will determine whether the US and China become competitors in a gentlemen’s sport or outright enemies demanding fealty from their allies.
Unfortunately, current trends point toward a world where China and the US continue to escalate toward confrontation, testing each other’s will rather than cooperating. Given all these factors we think that it is prudent to prepare for one-two years of chaos which might be followed by either dramatic change and reform or just continued sleepwalking into a bifurcation of the world into camps with two competing visions. Regrettably, it seems we have even odds for either outcome.
Francis Bassolino is the Managing Partner of Alaris, 
an investment and advisory firm based in Shanghai 
Francis_bassolino@alaris.com.cn
 
 
[1]
 
“Brace Yourself”:
 U.S. Business Leader in China During Trump 1.0 Sizes Up Trump 2.0. Forbes.
[2]
 2023 USTR Report to Congress on China’s WTO Compliance. 
PDF
.

subject: Staff Announcement
body:
Team – 
 
I wanted to share news that our colleague 
Sarah Nodarse
 will be leaving LCW effective January 31. With this change, Rebecca and Larry will be taking on additional client assignments, and we will rebalance the work among the team that Andrea and Patricia are doing to ensure that we have an equilibrium among the consultant staff.
 
In the 5 ½ years that Sarah has been with LCW she has contributed greatly to our success. She has proven herself to be a strong professional, building and leading some of our most profitable client relationships. Over the years, she has consistently ranked in the top 2 or 3 consultants in terms of revenue produced for LCW and also produced intellectual property like the SCI Model, while leading many of our efforts around assessments, evaluations, and system audits. Her impact will continue to benefit the firm for years to come.
 
Sarah will spend the next few weeks transitioning her work. More information on the transition plan will follow.
 
When the time comes, we will wish Sarah well as she moves on to other opportunities and is able to focus on herself and her daughter. Sarah’s experience, intellect, and advocacy for building inclusive cultures will be greatly missed, both professionally and personally.
 
In another change, 
Keri Luo
 will transition to a part time role. She will continue to own the LCW brand and visual identity and will add supporting Translations with multimedia and desktop publishing support to her remit. Keri will also play a support role in helping us transition PowerPoint content to Rise and Storyline moving forward. We are grateful for Keri’s flexibility and commitment to LCW.
 
Let me know, off thread, if you have any questions.
 
Chuck
 
 
Chuck Adams
 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
LCW

subject: Virtual Coffee Chat Re: Message from Elmer Dixon, President, SIETAR USA
body:
Sign Up for Virtual Coffee Chat  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We would like to hear your voice.
We are greatly concerned about the impact recent events have had on many in our Intercultural and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion community, and are keenly aware that the responses and reactions are as diverse as our community.
 Please join us for a virtual coffee chat by registering below.
December 5 at 3:00 PM Pacific Time / 6:00 PM Eastern Time
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register for Virtual Coffee Chat
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETARians,
To those of you contemplating some form of self-destruction over the election, I implore you to step away from the edge. We have seen this before and have survived to fight another day. But I must be real, this has been coming for a long time. American history, as much as it has been distorted to hide its ugly truth, has always been based in the suffering of people in the name of progress. From the original peoples who occupied these lands only to have uninvited immigrants destroy their communities and ways of life, to the enslaved Africans brought to these shores to build a “free economy” while the so-called forefathers declared that “All 
Men
 Are Created Equal” to the sounds of whips and cries for Freedom. Then the emancipation followed by an era of Bloody Reconstruction, Imperial Wizards, mass lynchings and the burning of Black Wall Street, the Civil Rights Movement, Jim Crow, Women’s Lib, and the election of Obama, we thought we had finally arrived only to be slapped back into reality in 2016.
And now after 4 years of celebration, “
The Wicked Witch is Dead
”, and more complacency, here we are again, holding the bag of unfulfilled dreams and promises of another false assumption of liberation. The American system of capitalism has, from the very beginning, relied upon and was built on racism, it is an inescapable truth. And once again, the liberties we seem to take for granted are at greater risk as we naively expected and relied on fair play, we forgot that the opposition has never played by the rules.
So here we are, wringing our hands, deflated and worried about what tomorrow will hold. We have the opportunity again, as we did in 2016, to stand up and face the truth. That without building a movement of solidarity, based on principles of freedom, equity, inclusion and the determination to keep fighting for justice, we are doomed to repeat this mess again.
In taking steps forward, as SIETARians, we must first ask ourselves; 
What do we stand for
? The SUSA Code of Ethics states “the values that SIETAR USA and its members uphold are 
diversity, respect, equity, integrity, objectivity, sustainability, community, and inclusion
”, 
the opposite of what the new administration represents. Whatever actions we decide to take, collectively and individually, we must uphold these values, or our actions are meaningless.
The Code of Ethics further states “
Members shall be guided by the UN Declaration of Human Rights, the UN Declaration on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women, the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples, the UN’s Global Compact, and the US Civil Rights Act of 1964.”
I challenge SUSA to stand strong, uphold these values and identify a path forward that identifies strategies to combat racism, fascism and any form of discrimination, and stand against all forms of oppression. The work is in front of us and I believe it should be the focus at the upcoming SUSA Conference in 2025.
 
Elmer Dixon
President, SIETAR USA
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We invite members and friends to Virtual Coffee Chat for an open discussion with Elmer Dixon, hosted by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee.
 
 
 
We invite members and friends to Virtual Coffee Chat for an open discussion with Elmer Dixon, hosted by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
December 5 at 3:00 PM Pacific Time / 6:00 PM Eastern Time
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The statement above was contributed by Elmer Dixon, President of SIETAR USA, in his personal capacity and from his deeply held convictions and may not reflect the views of all SIETARians or the SIETAR USA Board of Directors. Release of this important statement was approved by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee members: 
Elmer Dixon, President; Sue Shinomiya, President Elect; 
Monica Mumford, Treasurer; and Dr. C. Melissa Horne Neu, Secretary. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

subject: 1099 Year-End Forms
body:
Important changes to year-end tax forms 
͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ 
 
Sign in
 
 
Important changes to year‑end tax forms 
As a final reminder, starting in January 2025 for tax season 2024, we will no longer be printing and mailing 1099 tax forms to vendors and contractors as part of your QuickBooks Online Payroll or QuickBooks Contractor Payments subscription.
What’s happening?
Year-end 1099 tax forms will now cost $4 per form to print and mail to recipients. We’ll continue to send an electronic copy to recipients and e-file on your behalf to the IRS.** This year, 1099 e-filing with eligible states will also be included with your subscription.
What do I need to do?
When you’re ready to finalize your 1099s, simply choose how you’d like to deliver the forms to your vendors and contractors. By default, we electronically deliver 1099 forms to any vendors and contractors for whom we have emails on file at the time of e-filing. However, you will need to deliver physical copies to any recipients that have not given written consent to paperless 1099s by either choosing to download, print, and mail the forms yourself, or have QuickBooks print and mail copies for only $4 per form.
If you need to manage or cancel your subscription, log in and go to Settings ⚙ and select Subscriptions and billing. 
The QuickBooks Team 
View on web
 
ELM ID: 7432-010 
**1099 E-file:
 Create and e-file unlimited 1099-MISC and 1099-NEC forms in QuickBooks Online Payroll or QuickBooks Contractor Payments at no extra charge. Additional fees apply to print and mail a copy to your vendors and contractors. 1099 forms are e-filed only for the current filing year and for payments recorded in QuickBooks to your vendors or contractors. Includes state filings for eligible states participating in IRS Combined Federal/State Filing program; please check with your state agency on any additional state filing requirements.
This message was sent to randall@lcwmail.com, as an Intuit customer, consistent with your email preferences. If you have chosen not to receive marketing messages, you will continue to receive business communications about your selected Intuit product(s), which may either affect your service or software, your account, or which may be legally required.
Security

From:
 WP Engine <
no-reply@wpengine.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, November 29, 2024 10:32
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 WP Engine Security_ Plugin Vulnerability Notification - WordPress Button Plugin MaxButtons Plugin
 
Hello,
At WP Engine we take the security of your sites very seriously, and make every effort to keep our customers aware of any potential security risks. We are reaching out to you today because we identified resources that may be utilizing a vulnerable version of the maxbuttons plugin.
The lcwdev on lcwweb is running version 9.3.
WP Engine summary of the vulnerability: Data from an attacker could be interpreted as code by site visitors’ web browsers. The ability to run code in another site visitors’ browser can be abused to steal information, or modify site configuration.
This vulnerability’s information has been verified by WPScan. Please note that questions related to this notification should be directed to WPScan, the plugin Author or the 3rd-party researcher for the most accurate information.
Resources providing further information on this vulnerability:
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-10555
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-8968
https://research.cleantalk.org/cve-2024-10555/
https://research.cleantalk.org/cve-2024-8968/
https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/cab4d23e-e857-4b2f-b1ca-fbafd37524e0
https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/fcc97635-e939-4cb4-9851-6f6ac4f6ad47
 
To secure your site, please upgrade to the latest version of this plugin.
We always suggest making a backup before making any changes. You can learn how to do this in this article: 
https://wpengine.com/support/restore/
.
Would you like to avoid doing these updates manually in the future? Add the Smart Plugin Manager: 
https://my.wpengine.com/products/smart_plugin_manager
 to your plan today!
Finally, feel free to reach out to our Support team if you need assistance with backing up or updating your website!
Thanks,
-WP Engine Security Team

subject: Message from Elmer Dixon, President, SIETAR USA
body:
Message from Elmer Dixon, President, SIETAR USA ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETARians,
To those of you contemplating some form of self-destruction over the election, I implore you to step away from the edge. We have seen this before and have survived to fight another day. But I must be real, this has been coming for a long time. American history, as much as it has been distorted to hide its ugly truth, has always been based in the suffering of people in the name of progress. From the original peoples who occupied these lands only to have uninvited immigrants destroy their communities and ways of life, to the enslaved Africans brought to these shores to build a “free economy” while the so-called forefathers declared that “All 
Men
 Are Created Equal” to the sounds of whips and cries for Freedom. Then the emancipation followed by an era of Bloody Reconstruction, Imperial Wizards, mass lynchings and the burning of Black Wall Street, the Civil Rights Movement, Jim Crow, Women’s Lib, and the election of Obama, we thought we had finally arrived only to be slapped back into reality in 2016.
And now after 4 years of celebration, “
The Wicked Witch is Dead
”, and more complacency, here we are again, holding the bag of unfulfilled dreams and promises of another false assumption of liberation. The American system of capitalism has, from the very beginning, relied upon and was built on racism, it is an inescapable truth. And once again, the liberties we seem to take for granted are at greater risk as we naively expected and relied on fair play, we forgot that the opposition has never played by the rules.
So here we are, wringing our hands, deflated and worried about what tomorrow will hold. We have the opportunity again, as we did in 2016, to stand up and face the truth. That without building a movement of solidarity, based on principles of freedom, equity, inclusion and the determination to keep fighting for justice, we are doomed to repeat this mess again.
In taking steps forward, as SIETARians, we must first ask ourselves; 
What do we stand for
? The SUSA Code of Ethics states “the values that SIETAR USA and its members uphold are 
diversity, respect, equity, integrity, objectivity, sustainability, community, and inclusion
”, 
the opposite of what the new administration represents. Whatever actions we decide to take, collectively and individually, we must uphold these values, or our actions are meaningless.
The Code of Ethics further states “
Members shall be guided by the UN Declaration of Human Rights, the UN Declaration on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women, the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples, the UN’s Global Compact, and the US Civil Rights Act of 1964.”
I challenge SUSA to stand strong, uphold these values and identify a path forward that identifies strategies to combat racism, fascism and any form of discrimination, and stand against all forms of oppression. The work is in front of us and I believe it should be the focus at the upcoming SUSA Conference in 2025.
 
Elmer Dixon
President, SIETAR USA
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We would like to hear your voice.
We are greatly concerned about the impact recent events have had on many in our Intercultural and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion community, and are keenly aware that the responses and reactions are as diverse as our community.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We invite members and friends to Virtual Coffee Chat for an open discussion with Elmer Dixon, hosted by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee.
 
 
 
We invite members and friends to Virtual Coffee Chat for an open discussion with Elmer Dixon, hosted by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
December 5 at 3:00 PM Pacific Time / 6:00 PM Eastern Time
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The statement above was contributed by Elmer Dixon, President of SIETAR USA, in his personal capacity and from his deeply held convictions and may not reflect the views of all SIETARians or the SIETAR USA Board of Directors. Release of this important statement was approved by the SIETAR USA Executive Committee members: 
Elmer Dixon, President; Sue Shinomiya, President Elect; 
Monica Mumford, Treasurer; and Dr. C. Melissa Horne Neu, Secretary. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

body:
Hey Chuck,
I’ve been getting this email for months – and I assumed that the IT folks were on it. But apparently not. Just FYI.
-R
 
 
From:
 Register.com <no-reply@account.register.com>

 Friday, November 29, 2024 22:03
To:
 LCW Support <support@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Action Required: CSR Needed for your SSL Certificate (Xpress) for LCWINCLUSION.COM
 
 
 
Call 1-866-888-6306
Action Required for Your SSL Certificate 
 
Hi Monica,
We still have not received a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) for the SSL Certificate listed below. A CSR is your website's unique identifier from which your SSL Certificate is created. A CSR is generated from the software platform used by your hosting provider. 
Please note that we cannot begin the validation process for your SSL Certificate until we receive your CSR. 
SSL Certificate Details:
SSL Certificate: SSL Certificate (Xpress)for LCWINCLUSION.COM
Term*: 2 year(s)
Certificate ID: 394914714
Purchase Date & Time: 2024-06-03 18:44:40.0
HOW TO OBTAIN A CSR
Your website hosting provider must generate the CSR for your SSL Certificate. Contact your hosting provider's network administrator and ask them to: 
Generate a CSR for you
Identify the software platform and version of the Web server
NEXT STEPS
Once you have obtained the CSR, you must provide it to us by following these steps: 
Log in to: 
Account Manager
Click on 
My Security Products
 in the 
My Products & Services
 tab to be taken to a page listing the details of your SSL Certificate. If you have more than one SSL Certificate in your account, please click on a package name to see the details for each SSL Certificate.
Click on the 
Provide CSR
 link.
Choose your Web Host's server software and copy the CSR into the entry field. 
Click Go.
If you have any questions or need assistance, please give us a call or get online support. 
Best Regards, 
Register.com

questions, 24/7

Giving Tuesday 2024
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
December 3
 is Giving Tuesday, a global day of generosity. And what better way to participate than to help support your favorite professional association? 
As a member of SIETAR USA you know the importance of being part of a professional group who understands who you are, what you are about, and wants the best for you in your chosen profession. One way you can ensure that SIETAR USA has the resources to continue to support you and your Intercultural/DEIB colleagues is by 
making a gift 
to SIETAR USA that can help expand our professional programs (such as the webinar series, mentoring, conferences, Saturday Seminars) and improve our reach in the United States and beyond. 
Mark your calendar and donate this Giving Tuesday!
 
Your generosity helps create a better world.

subject: WP Engine Security_ Plugin Vulnerability Notification - WordPress Button Plugin MaxButtons Plugin
body:
Hello,
At WP Engine we take the security of your sites very seriously, and make every effort to keep our customers aware of any potential security risks. We are reaching out to you today because we identified resources that may be utilizing a vulnerable version of the maxbuttons plugin.
The lcwdev on lcwweb is running version 9.3.
WP Engine summary of the vulnerability: Data from an attacker could be interpreted as code by site visitors’ web browsers. The ability to run code in another site visitors’ browser can be abused to steal information, or modify site configuration.
This vulnerability’s information has been verified by WPScan. Please note that questions related to this notification should be directed to WPScan, the plugin Author or the 3rd-party researcher for the most accurate information.
Resources providing further information on this vulnerability:
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-10555
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-8968
https://research.cleantalk.org/cve-2024-10555/
https://research.cleantalk.org/cve-2024-8968/
https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/cab4d23e-e857-4b2f-b1ca-fbafd37524e0
https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/fcc97635-e939-4cb4-9851-6f6ac4f6ad47
 
To secure your site, please upgrade to the latest version of this plugin.
We always suggest making a backup before making any changes. You can learn how to do this in this article: 
https://wpengine.com/support/restore/
.
Would you like to avoid doing these updates manually in the future? Add the Smart Plugin Manager: 
https://my.wpengine.com/products/smart_plugin_manager
 to your plan today!
Finally, feel free to reach out to our Support team if you need assistance with backing up or updating your website!
Thanks,
-WP Engine Security Team

View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Dear Randy,
We hope to see you on December 11th. 
Webinar
'Getting Ready for Your Transformational Growth in 2025'
 
 
 
 
December 11th, 2024 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
Join SIETAR USA’s Webinar Team for our final webinar of 2024. Let’s continue with the lessons of Transformational Learning from our November webinar with Lewis Brown Griggs. Lewis’s experiences and learning centered around his shift from Doing to Being, personal transformations. Transformational Learning is sometimes referred to “Accidental” learning but we can do some planning as well. Together let’s explore what we do want for our growth in 2025 and what might be some beginning steps. And, we’re going into the holiday season so let’s have some fun, too. Even in the midst of Transformational Learning we can’t take ourselves too seriously. 
As you’re saying farewell to 2024, take a deep centering breath, pause, reflect on 2024, another breath, pause. Now use the link below to get a start on 2025 by registering for SIETAR USA’s webinar Wednesday, December 11, 11:30am to 1:00pm (Eastern Time).

subject: Support SIETAR USA on Giving Tuesday 2024
body:
Calling our community... ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Giving Tuesday 2024
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
December 3
 is Giving Tuesday, a global day of generosity. And what better way to participate than to help support your favorite professional association? 
As a member of SIETAR USA you know the importance of being part of a professional group who understands who you are, what you are about, and wants the best for you in your chosen profession. One way you can ensure that SIETAR USA has the resources to continue to support you and your Intercultural/DEIB colleagues is by 
making a gift 
to SIETAR USA that can help expand our professional programs (such as the webinar series, mentoring, conferences, Saturday Seminars) and improve our reach in the United States and beyond. 
Mark your calendar and donate this Giving Tuesday!
 
Your generosity helps create a better world. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Donate

subject: New Payroll Experience on the HR Platform
body:
Dear Valued Customer
,
We’re excited to share that the new payroll experience on HR Platform is live! This experience is designed to help you and your team process payroll more efficiently and has received positive feedback from early adopters. 
Enhancements include:
Pay runs are accessible on the payroll overview tab and have additional filtering capabilities, such as payroll types, status and date range.
New pay calendar views provide a 12-month calendar option that can be downloaded for printing. 
The Gross-to-Net Summary view has been redesigned to display total hours paid and to include filtering options for real-time insight into totals by labor group. 
Warning indicators to identify when separated employees are included in payroll.
Organizational details, including rate of pay, location, department, and worker type, are now displayed at the worker level.
You can take advantage of these enhancements now by clicking “Make the Switch” on the Payroll Overview tab in the HR Platform as shown below: 
To help you navigate the new experience, view this 
product tour
 or 
log in
 to the platform to access the below resources:
Help Center Articles
Training Videos
For additional questions or assistance, please reach out to the 
Customer Support team
. 
Regards,
TriNet

subject: Upcoming Changes in North America
body:
Dear Valued Supplier,  
We are contacting you to offer additional information regarding the operational changes we are making to further establish Kenvue as an independent company following our separation from Johnson & Johnson last year. These transitions are vital for establishing our digital-first ways of working and setting us — and you — up for improved efficiency and success.
As part of the exit from J&J, we will transition invoice processing systems from February 24, 2025. This will enable us to effectively maintain our services with you. This letter is to provide key information for the transition process and system cutover. 
 
Migrating catalogs and current Ariba connections
If you do not currently use Ariba you will continue to receive POs via email. 
We will continue to use Ariba internally to create purchase orders only, we will not be using any Ariba invoice module.
If you do use Ariba, we will create a new Kenvue Ariba ID as we transition. You can expect to receive a trading relationship request (TRR) communication from SAP, inviting you to continue our trading relationship in the SAP Ariba Business Network. Please look out for this email and accept the invitation when it comes through
Suppliers with Ariba catalogs will — where applicable — be asked to re-upload the list of products or services you offer to Kenvue into our new profile.
We will notify you when you need to take this action. In the meantime, please make sure your Ariba expert and IT team are prepared for the changes.
Changes to Purchase Order (PO) creation
Our transition to the Kenvue environment will temporarily affect all Indirect POs that remain open at the time of the transition. 
Please see the definition of ‘Direct’ and ‘Indirect’ below.
POs created and delivered in full before the transition period will continue to payment. 
Unfulfilled and partially fulfilled POs will be closed and Kenvue will create replacement POs, with a new PO number in the new system.
All Indirect* POs (PO format 97####### or 99#######) that remain open at the time of the transition. Unfulfilled and partially fulfilled POs will be closed and Kenvue will create replacement POs, with a new PO number in the new system.
Direct** purchases will retain the same PO number. If you are registered within the Ariba network you will receive communication from Ariba, otherwise please reach out to Ariba.
If you are not registered within the Ariba network, you will receive POs via email, which will ask you to register for the Ariba network. Please disregard this message. You can continue to download your PDF PO attached, there is no need to register with Ariba.
More information will be provided in the coming months, but if you do have queries, please email the central supplier mailbox: RA-JX2-SupplierCommu@kenvue.com.
Changes to Accounts Payable 
 
Some key dates and payments will temporarily change during the transition period, and these will be shared in future communications.
New Accounts Payable Portal 
Effective February 24, 2025, vendors will gain access to a newly designed Kenvue Accounts Payable (AP) Portal. Vendors can use the Kenvue AP Portal to submit and reply to support tickets, access knowledge articles and policies, engage in real-time chat with the Kenvue support team, manage their account, view purchase order status, and track invoices and payments.  It is important to note that invoices may not be submitted through the Kenvue AP Portal (unlike in the legacy environment that we are transitioning from). 
Once the Kenvue AP Portal goes live, you will receive an automated email from “Kenvue AP Portal” that will include instructions on how to register and access the portal. We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to enhancing your experience with our new AP Portal. 
Company Name Change
We have already updated our company name for the US and Canada Kenvue subsidiaries noted below, to reflect Kenvue branding and independence. Please ensure to use the correct names for these subsidiaries. Please note that any invoices received with incorrect billing details will be rejected.
New name in Canada: Kenvue Canada Inc. (perviously Johnson & Johnson Inc.)
New Name in US: Kenvue Brands LLC (previously Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc.) 
It’s important to note that there will be no change to other existing details, such as tax IDs, product master data, bank account numbers, order management, DUNS numbers and existing agreements. The underlying company name (parent company – Kenvue Inc.) remains the same.
Actions for You  
If this communication has not reached the correct person, please let us know by replying to this email, whom we should contact instead
Please share this with people within your organization who may find this information relevant
Accept the trading relationship request (TRR) invitation to continue trading with Kenvue  
Look out for future communications with further information 
As we approach our transition date of February 24, 2025, we will share more information at key milestones, prior to the transition. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to connect with your Kenvue key contact or send your queries to: RA-JX2-SupplierCommu@kenvue.com.
 Best regards, 
 Kenvue Procurement 
*Indirect Services refers to materials and services supporting the operation not impacting the production
**Direct Services usually refers to materials (and in few cases services or logistics) which impact production

subject: µChicago: New institute to confront climate change
body:
µChicago, a monthly science newsletter. 
Problems viewing this email? 
View online.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
November 2024
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
UChicago launches the Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth
 
 
 
 
 
“Climate change is the greatest risk to human well-being over the next century. It is not a problem in isolation,” says Michael Greenstone, LAB’87, the Milton Friedman Distinguished Service Professor in Economics. But approaches to this problem must also factor in “the need for growth and improvements in human well-being,” he says. 
Greenstone serves as the founding faculty director of the University’s new Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth. The interdisciplinary research hub merges technology, economics, policy, and education to address this global challenge with effective solutions.
 
 
 
 
 
Uniting experts on sustainable solutions
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Founding executive editor of 
Cipher
 Amy Harder, molecular engineering professor Y. Shirley Meng, former Department of Energy Under Secretary for Science Paul Dabbar, and Exelon president and CEO Calvin Butler discuss the future of clean energy storage.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
On October 30 the University of Chicago launched the 
Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth
 to take on the intertwined challenges of climate change and economic prosperity. The new research institute brings together UChicago experts on energy policy, new energy technologies, and climate systems engineering to identify ways to meet those two urgent global needs. 
Greenstone brings deep policy and economics expertise to his role as the institute’s faculty director. Molecular engineering professor Y. Shirley Meng and professor of geophysical sciences David Keith will lead the institute’s 
Energy Technologies
 and 
Climate Systems Engineering
 Initiatives, respectively, forming the scientific foundation of the institute’s work. 
In addition to research, the institute will introduce the 
Chicago Curriculum on Climate and Sustainable Growth
, designed to give students a global, experientially informed perspective on complex climate issues through the lenses of economics, technology, and policy. The curriculum has been developed for UChicago in such a way that eventually it can also be adopted by other universities.
At the launch event panelists from around the world—with an array of perspectives on climate change—discussed the power of investment in clean energy and the role that technological innovation can play in a greener future. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
More about Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth initiatives 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
1
 
 
 
 
 
Pore power: In Meng’s battery-focused lab, researchers have developed 
a new method
 to create multiple nanopores simultaneously within materials, which could improve techniques to extract the metals required for advanced grid-scale batteries.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2
 
 
 
 
 
A new frontier: Learn the ins and outs of climate systems engineering from Keith’s 2023 
Big Brains
 podcast
 appearance, and read his own case for the emerging field of geoengineering in a 
New York Times
 op-ed
.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
3
 
 
 
 
 
A salty solution: Researchers at PME and in Meng’s battery lab have created the 
first anode-free sodium solid-state battery
, a breakthrough that could enable affordable high-capacity batteries.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Spotlight
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Building a “portfolio of batteries”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
From left: Shirley Meng and PME students Jing Wang and Haozhe Zhang look at an electron microscope at Argonne National Laboratory in 2022. Photography by John Zich.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Y. Shirley Meng, a leading expert in battery technology, heads the 
Energy Technologies Initiative
 within the Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth. Storage is a key component of a sustainable future as economies shift to renewable energy sources. Meng, a professor at the Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering with a joint appointment at Argonne National Laboratory, and her team use imaging and computational modeling to diagnose battery weaknesses and to engineer solutions for electric vehicles, mobile devices, and quantum computers.
 
 
 
 
 
Learn more about Meng’s work in the 
February
 
µChicago
 and in a 2022 
Big Brains
 podcast
.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In case you missed it
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Quantum state of mind: 
Read about quantum mechanics and explore how the tiniest particles in the universe can have a big impact on the fields of physics, chemistry, computer science, and medicine at UChicago.
 
 
 
 
A Nobel legacy:
 
Look back at a few recent Nobel laureates and test your knowledge of UChicago’s earliest winners (or learn about the 
newest UChicago science Nobelist
).
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Support engineering at UChicago.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sign up
 to receive 
µChicago
 monthly.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Institute for Climate and Sustainable Growth
Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering
More science at UChicago News
More science at UChicago Magazine
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago 
5801 South Ellis Avenue, Chicago, IL 60637 
1.800.955.0065

subject: [Action Required]: Upcoming deactivation of your Asana "Personal Projects" domain
body:
[Action Required]: Upcoming deactivation of your Asana "Personal Projects" domain
 
Log in to Asana
 
Dear Randall Stieghorst,
 
We noticed you have not logged into your Asana "Personal Projects" domain in the past two years. For security purposes, we are conducting a routine cleanup of inactive accounts.
 
If you do not resume activity in your "Personal Projects" domain within the next 60 days, your access to this domain will be deactivated, including losing access to your data in this domain. This will NOT affect your access to any other Asana domain, workspace or organization.
 
To maintain your account and keep your data, simply log into your "Personal Projects" domain and create at least 1 task. To access your Personal Projects log into your Asana account > click your profile picture > select "Personal Projects".
 
If you have any questions about this update, please feel free to post them in our 
Community Forum
, where our community managers and Forum Leaders will be happy to help.
 
Thank you for being a valued user of Asana.
 
Warm regards,
The Asana Team

body:
Extended Deadline: December 6th ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
2024 SIETAR USA Leadership Call for Nominations
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
New Submission Deadline: Dec 6 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETAR USA Members and Colleagues, 
The 2024 Call for Nominations for the Board of Directors of SIETAR USA is now open. We invite all members to step up and join us in the leadership of our organization. We are committed to developing a diverse Board team that leads, inspires and connects with all our members, helping to transform and sustain our intercultural community into the future.
All SIETAR USA members are invited to participate in the nominations process and to vote for candidates. We also welcome you to bring energy and creative ideas by getting involved in our project teams. It is up to all of us to create a professional society that best serves our individual and community needs, and that promotes intercultural understanding with a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. 
        
You may nominate yourself or another member of the organization.
  
Any candidate for Board positions must meet the following criteria in addition to the role-specific requirements listed in each position description. 
Possess a strong background and understanding of intercultural communications and/or fields of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB)
Member in good standing with SIETAR USA (or willing to become a
 
member)
Have attended at least one SIETAR USA conference in recent years
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OPEN POSITIONS
MEMBERSHIP OUTREACH & DIVERSITY
 
(3-Year Term January 1, 2025, to
 
December 31, 2027)
 
The Membership, Outreach and Diversity Director is responsible for establishing membership policies and benefits, overseeing membership recruitment, expanding the diversity of the SIETAR USA membership, and reaching out to new audiences for inclusion in the Society. The Director of this Portfolio is encouraged to establish a committee to support the work of expanding the membership rolls.
 
 
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT (3-Year Term January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027) 
The Professional Development Portfolio Director is responsible for developing and monitoring a program of information and opportunities that sustain the professional development of the membership.  The Director will explore how the professional needs of the membership can be met through activities sponsored and/or supported by SIETAR USA.  The Director of this Portfolio will have conference-related responsibilities such as reviewing proposals, sourcing speakers and working with the conference chair to develop the conference program.  The Director of this Portfolio is encouraged to establish a committee to support the work. 
 
SPONSORSHIP PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT (2-Year Term January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2026) 
The Sponsor Development Director is responsible for bridging individuals, companies and institutions with SIETAR USA to provide supporting funds for the annual conference and other activities throughout the year.  The Director of this Portfolio will initiate, direct and support the relationships with sponsors and association partners, highlighting their support and providing them with good value for their investment in SIETAR USA.  This Director is encouraged to establish two committees to focus on a. conference sponsorship activities and b. supporters to provide a financial foundation for other society activities. 
Detailed position descriptions for these roles, and all roles, can be reviewed using the link below.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Board Position Descriptions 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Submission Deadline 
December 6th - 5pm PST
 
 
 
 
 
 
All nominations must be submitted in writing by e-mail to 
info@sietarusa.org 
and 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
.  Please email both addresses.
 
Please be sure to include your resume or CV and a brief statement of intent that addresses the following: 
Why do you want to serve on the SIETAR USA Board of Directors?
What do you consider the primary strength(s) or skill(s) you bring to SIETAR USA?
What are your vision and objectives if elected as director for your portfolio of choice?
By submitting your statement, you agree to serve out your full term and to abide by the Bylaws of SIETAR USA if selected.
Process
The Nominations Committee identifies candidates through a nomination process for each position based on the required skill and knowledge sets needed for each position.  The Slate is then announced to the members of SIETAR USA.  If there is more than one candidate for a position, an election will be held.
Term of Service 
Board members will serve a three-year term starting January 1, 2025 and carry responsibilities for the portfolio for which they were elected.
Note that the role of 
Sponsor Partnership Development
 for the 2024 election is a commitment of two (2) years to fulfill and complete the term that began January 1, 2024.
Upon completion of a three-year term, every board member can choose to
self-nominate for three  more years of the same or a different board position and go through the nomination process as any new candidate would during that same nomination cycle. According to the Bylaws, SIETAR USA Board membership generally cannot exceed nine (9) consecutive years.
General Duties of Members of the Board of Directors
Board members serve a three-year term (unless noted otherwise) and carry responsibilities for the portfolio to which they are appointed.
Board members must sign and abide by the Board Code of Ethics and Conflict of Interest documents. As with all members of the society, they are encouraged to support and sign the Living Code of Ethics. 
Board members are expected to attend the SIETAR USA Annual Conference, the Annual Board Meeting (a one-day in-person meeting before or after the conference), and the Board of Directors Annual Retreat (a three-day business meeting held each year in February or March).
Board members are expected to participate in monthly Board of Directors teleconference meetings.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process. Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
info@sietarusa.org
.  
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process. Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
info@sietarusa.org
.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Thank you for supporting SIETAR USA!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sue Shinomiya
SIETAR USA President-Elect & Nominations Committee Co-Chair
 
 
 
Stacie Walton
SIETAR USA Leadership Development Director and Nominations Committee Co-Chair

subject: SCORM Cloud: Account Limit Reached
body:
Hey there RANDALL, 
Wow, you really have been busy! We just noticed you've created 100 registrations this month in your SCORM Cloud account, reaching your total included registration limit. 
Because your account is equipped to handle overages, any more registrations created during this billing cycle will only cost you an additional $3.60 per registration. Your next bill is scheduled for November 26. At that time, any overages will be calculated and charged and your usage will be reset. 
It may be time to think about upgrading your account (or maybe not, you know better than we do). If you do decide to upgrade, keep in mind that we have plenty of account tiers to choose from so you can find a usage level that best meets your needs. 
Log in
 to SCORM Cloud anytime to check out more information about your usage and to upgrade your account. 
Thanks! 
-- 
The SCORM Cloud Team 
P.S.- Did you know SCORM Cloud now supports the xAPI? 
Check it out!

subject: UChicago PRIDE Newsletter
body:
UChicago Upcoming Events & Programs
 
Dear Randall,
We hope this note finds you in good health and happy autumn holiday spirit! We are thrilled to inform you of an opportunity to gather in gratitude alongside students on campus this fall. 
 
Sign-Up Today: Harvest Meal with LGBTQ Student Life
Thursday, November 21
6:00PM - 8:00PM
Hyde Park Campus
 
Celebrate the harvest season with gratitude for queer and trans community at UChicago. We invite alumni to join current students for a catered meal serving up all the classics and new favorites. There will be opportunities for participants to gain insights into the student experience (then and now!) and share life’s wisdom.
Alumni tickets are limited. Register today to reserve your seat!
 
Presented by LGBTQ Student Life with support from UChicago Alumni PRIDE.
Join the UChicago Alumni PRIDE 
Facebook
 group to connect with fellow alumni and browse in-person and virtual events on our UChicago Alumni & Friends 
club site
.
See you in person and on the Zoom screen soon!
-Your UChicago PRIDE Board
 
 
 
Harvest Meal with LGBTQ Student Life
Date/Time: 
Thursday, November 21, 2024 | 6:00 p.m.–8:00 p.m. (CST)
UChicago's LGBTQ Student Life invites you to join current students for a cozy catered meal, featuring all your favorite holiday dishes and some new twists. This gathering is a chance to connect, hear about student life past and present, and share stories and wisdom with alumni.
Location:
 UChicago Divinity School - Swift Hall Common Room | 1025 E 58th St., Chicago, IL
Cost: 
$35 | Limited tickets available
 
 
For questions
, please email 
UChicago Alumni PRIDE 
at 
alumni@alumnimail.uchicago.edu
 or via phone at 
1.800.955.0065 
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago
5801 South Ellis Avenue, Chicago, IL 60637

subject: Will you share your perspective on UChicago and our community?
body:
Take a quick survey to help us better meet your needs. 
 
 
Dear Friend of the University,
I am writing to invite you to share your perspective on the University of Chicago and our global community of alumni and friends by completing the survey linked below.
We are always striving to better understand our community and offer opportunities to engage that are interesting and valuable to you. This survey is designed to gather information about you, and our community of alumni and friends as a whole, to ensure that our work is reflective of your needs and interests.
Your feedback is critical and will provide valuable insight for how the University of Chicago can better meet your needs and foster a stronger and more vibrant community into the future.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Take the survey »
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The link above is unique to you. The survey can be taken only once and should not be forwarded to anyone else to complete. The survey should take about 15 minutes.
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your experience as a member of our global community.
Kind regards,
Armin Afsahi
Vice President, Alumni Relations and Development 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago
5801 South Ellis Avenue
Chicago, IL 60637
1.800.955.0065
 
 
This Alumni Feedback email was sent to randall@lcwmail.com.
If you no longer wish to receive these emails, you may 
unsubscribe
 at any time.

subject: Member Update from SIETAR USA
body:
Connect with SIETAR USA through events, opportunities, remembrances, and insights. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Why me? What makes you think I should be on the SIETAR USA Board of Directors? Why would I want to do that? Too many people see a call for nominations and think: “that’s not for me.” Perhaps you might want to reconsider that response. SIETAR USA has an opportunity for you! 
- Read More -
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register for SIETAR USA's November Webinar: Growing DEIB and Intercultural Consciousness.
 
  
 
 
 
Register for SIETAR USA's November Webinar: Growing DEIB and Intercultural Consciousness.
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Growing DEIB and Intercultural Consciousness. How do you move corporations to focus on their human resources?  How do you get them to grow their DEIB and intercultural consciousness?  Transformational learning builds on the premise that human beings need to understand the meaning of their experience. Learn from Lewis Griggs what happened to him and how he has applied that to his work with others to grow their DEIB and intercultural consciousness. 
- Read More -
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
SIETAR USA Remembers 
Les Thornton
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
One of the important functions that a professional association can perform is to acknowledge and honor the contributions of people who were active members of SIETAR USA during their time.  SIETAR International conducted its first conference in 1976. Its history is full of people who made major contributions to the Intercultural/DEIB field, SIETAR USA, and our precursor SIETAR International. Gone but not forgotten. 
- Read More - 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Is This Your Time to Become an Entrepreneur?
 Learn the three myths and guidelines to become a successful entrepreneur from Dr. Neal Goodman. 
- Read More -

subject: RE: updated vision ppt
body:
Oh, and we’ll need to be sure that we can show a cash flow forecast, with existing cash balances, receivables, signed SOWs, and projected sales…together with existing expenses and overhead, plus planned increases in those expenses, to show that we can get to summer 2025 without running into another cash crunch that cancels all of those visionary plans.
-R
 
 
From:
 Randall Stieghorst 
Sent:
 Wednesday, November 13, 2024 11:57
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 updated vision ppt
 
I have updated this deck to include simple bubbles around the LCW25 idea. Just another idea on how it is perhaps presented, at the highest level, to the team.
 
The obvious question, after getting people’s buy-in, will be – so what do we need to do between now and then (summer 2025) to make this a reality? We know that we have (and Alisa has expressed) some ideas on what will make that happen and the incremental steps that will be required (in 1, 3, or 6 months) so we will take those visionary goals and create a plan to reach that. We want to have a map…we want you to see the map…and we want the destination to be visible and achievable. You all need to have confidence that we can get there.
 
And for us, we need to confirm that these visionary changes will address enough of the root causes to make a difference in LCW’s trajectory.
 
Just throwing this out there for now.
-R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
LCW

subject: Re: draft of presentation for vision
body:
I agree. May you please figure out how to transform this plan with action steps into something the team will digest? To me it's mainly deleting some of the details from the content, but it is important to have buy in to the detailed version from our executive team. As we gain more insights from Randy's session, adding to this is what we should do. This is a living and breathing document. 
Regarding KPIs, agreed, this is a rough draft, and hopefully we can find the best version out there.
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner (She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner,
 
LCW
