From:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, November 13, 2024 9:52:19 AM
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: draft of presentation for vision
I agree. I understand that there is an urgency around this messaging but if we do it wrong it is for naught. We will lose them completely, if we haven’t already.
 
There is too much information in this version. We first need to gain their buy-in by transferring what we heard 
from them
 to a ‘new’ vision for the future. Once we have that in place we can present the plan to get there, including the painful decisions that will need to be made to achieve them. That’s where their buy-in is most critical.
 
I also have some concerns about the KPIs but we can discuss those later.
 
Chuck

subject: RE: Add'l suggestion - stepping back
body:
I’m not sure when/how that transition was supposed to happen (Because, for example, you were present at and even lead the original Root Cause Analysis – not Chuck). One of the things we did not get to during our call the other day was the additional commentary from the team, during my session with them, as it relates to root causes. There are still some relatively strong feelings that would seem to indicate to me that a further distancing is necessary and/or would be highly beneficial to team morale/motivation.
Thx,
R
 
 
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, November 11, 2024 23:30
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Add'l suggestion - stepping back
 
Hey Randy,
 
Thanks for the note below. I have transitioned leading all meetings to Chuck. That was part of the strategy. I appreciate you confirming it.
 
My powerpoint will be sent to Chuck tomorrow and it will contain action steps.  
 
Thanks,
 
Alisa
 
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, November 11, 2024 10:09 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Add'l suggestion - stepping back
 
Hey Alisa,
I know you have tried to step back somewhat from the forefront and let Chuck run things – and indeed my suggestion was that Chuck lead this conversation *
without you
*. In light of the conversation I had with the team, and given that a vision/strategy is going to be presented to employees soon, I think this may also be a good time to go a bit further. My recommendation to you (based on having conversations with the different employees), is that you truly step back, more officially. I would suggest you craft a “stepaway” note to employees, where you acknowledge in clear and unambiguous terms, ownership of the problems that have arisen. I know you have tried to accept responsibility for some of the challenges in the past, but that was usually cushioned with explanations of how your strengths played into those mistakes. I think they just want to hear that you understand where and how and why things went wrong – without trying to make things sound rosy. 
 
And when I say “truly step back”, I think that means removing yourself from any regular meetings with employees, except with Chuck of course. Letting Chuck be the face (and only face) of LCW leadership may bring significant benefit to team morale (again, based on my conversations with people). That doesn’t mean you can’t be part of any conversations of interest to you (like a Friday thinkathon perhaps) – but you probably shouldn’t be convening or leading any meetings.
 
I’m happy to chat more about why I think this is necessary now – and also why it should be a note, rather than you presenting it to employees (e.g., to truly step back, to allow for wordsmithing, to avoid rambling, etc.).
 
Please CC me when you send your draft of the vision statements (in PPT) to Chuck today.
Thx,
R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
LCW

I think they just want to hear that you understand where and how and why things went wrong – without trying to make things sound rosy. 
 
And when I say “truly step back”, I think that means removing yourself from any regular meetings with employees, except with Chuck of course. Letting Chuck be the face (and only face) of LCW leadership may bring significant benefit to team morale (again, based on my conversations with people). That doesn’t mean you can’t be part of any conversations of interest to you (like a Friday thinkathon perhaps) – but you probably shouldn’t be convening or leading any meetings.
 
I’m happy to chat more about why I think this is necessary now – and also why it should be a note, rather than you presenting it to employees (e.g., to truly step back, to allow for wordsmithing, to avoid rambling, etc.).
 
Please CC me when you send your draft of the vision statements (in PPT) to Chuck today.
Thx,
R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
LCW

subject: SIETAR USA BOARD NOMINATIONS
body:
Extended Deadline: December 6th ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
2024 SIETAR USA Leadership Call for Nominations
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETAR USA Members and Colleagues, 
The 2024 Call for Nominations for the Board of Directors of SIETAR USA is now open. We invite all members to step up and join us in the leadership of our organization. We are committed to developing a diverse Board team that leads, inspires and connects with all our members, helping to transform and sustain our intercultural community into the future.
All SIETAR USA members are invited to participate in the nominations process and to vote for candidates. We also welcome you to bring energy and creative ideas by getting involved in our project teams. It is up to all of us to create a professional society that best serves our individual and community needs, and that promotes intercultural understanding with a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. 
        
You may nominate yourself or another member of the organization.
  
Any candidate for Board positions must meet the following criteria in addition to the role-specific requirements listed in each position description. 
Possess a strong background and understanding of intercultural communications and/or fields of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB)
Member in good standing with SIETAR USA (or willing to become a
 
member)
Have attended at least one SIETAR USA conference in recent years
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
OPEN POSITIONS
MEMBERSHIP OUTREACH & DIVERSITY
 
(3-Year Term January 1, 2025, to
 
December 31, 2027)
 
The Membership, Outreach and Diversity Director is responsible for establishing membership policies and benefits, overseeing membership recruitment, expanding the diversity of the SIETAR USA membership, and reaching out to new audiences for inclusion in the Society. The Director of this Portfolio is encouraged to establish a committee to support the work of expanding the membership rolls.
 
 
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT (3-Year Term January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027) 
The Professional Development Portfolio Director is responsible for developing and monitoring a program of information and opportunities that sustain the professional development of the membership.  The Director will explore how the professional needs of the membership can be met through activities sponsored and/or supported by SIETAR USA.  The Director of this Portfolio will have conference-related responsibilities such as reviewing proposals, sourcing speakers and working with the conference chair to develop the conference program.  The Director of this Portfolio is encouraged to establish a committee to support the work. 
 
SPONSORSHIP PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT (2-Year Term January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2026) 
The Sponsor Development Director is responsible for bridging individuals, companies and institutions with SIETAR USA to provide supporting funds for the annual conference and other activities throughout the year.  The Director of this Portfolio will initiate, direct and support the relationships with sponsors and association partners, highlighting their support and providing them with good value for their investment in SIETAR USA.  This Director is encouraged to establish two committees to focus on a. conference sponsorship activities and b. supporters to provide a financial foundation for other society activities. 
Detailed position descriptions for these roles, and all roles, can be reviewed using the link below.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Board Position Descriptions 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Submission Deadline 
December 6th - 5pm PST
 
 
 
 
 
 
All nominations must be submitted in writing by e-mail to 
info@sietarusa.org 
and 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
.  Please email both addresses.
 
Please be sure to include your resume or CV and a brief statement of intent that addresses the following: 
Why do you want to serve on the SIETAR USA Board of Directors?
What do you consider the primary strength(s) or skill(s) you bring to SIETAR USA?
What are your vision and objectives if elected as director for your portfolio of choice?
By submitting your statement, you agree to serve out your full term and to abide by the Bylaws of SIETAR USA if selected.
Process
The Nominations Committee identifies candidates through a nomination process for each position based on the required skill and knowledge sets needed for each position.  The Slate is then announced to the members of SIETAR USA.  If there is more than one candidate for a position, an election will be held.
Term of Service 
Board members will serve a three-year term starting January 1, 2025 and carry responsibilities for the portfolio for which they were elected.
Note that the role of 
Sponsor Partnership Development
 for the 2024 election is a commitment of two (2) years to fulfill and complete the term that began January 1, 2024.
Upon completion of a three-year term, every board member can choose to
self-nominate for three  more years of the same or a different board position and go through the nomination process as any new candidate would during that same nomination cycle. According to the Bylaws, SIETAR USA Board membership generally cannot exceed nine (9) consecutive years.
General Duties of Members of the Board of Directors
Board members serve a three-year term (unless noted otherwise) and carry responsibilities for the portfolio to which they are appointed.
Board members must sign and abide by the Board Code of Ethics and Conflict of Interest documents. As with all members of the society, they are encouraged to support and sign the Living Code of Ethics. 
Board members are expected to attend the SIETAR USA Annual Conference, the Annual Board Meeting (a one-day in-person meeting before or after the conference), and the Board of Directors Annual Retreat (a three-day business meeting held each year in February or March).
Board members are expected to participate in monthly Board of Directors teleconference meetings.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process. Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
info@sietarusa.org
.  
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process. Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
info@sietarusa.org
.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Thank you for supporting SIETAR USA!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sue Shinomiya
SIETAR USA President-Elect & Nominations Committee Co-Chair
 
 
 
Stacie Walton
SIETAR USA Leadership Development Director and Nominations Committee Co-Chair
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
4880 Lower Roswell Rd, Suite 165 • Marietta , GA • 30068

Hi, thanks for facilitating the discussion and putting this together, Randy. 
 
I do have an issue with page 3, first column. 
 
We never got back to our feet with Marketing (not BD & Marketing) because we lost our Marketing department. We did have had dedicated, qualified BD person (me) from July 2023-Aug 2024 – but we couldn’t do as much marketing (nor as high quality marketing) as before because we lost our Marketers. Around Aug of this year I was pulled more deeply into Consulting and client needs, and so my attention on BD had been greatly reduced. My role is unclear in that I’m a ‘renaissance woman’ (as Sarah would say) these days vs. just focused on BD.

I live and work in Chicago, IL – on the unceded territory of the Pokagon band of Potawatomi. See 
this article
 in the Chicago History Museum Magazine for a native perspective on land acknowledgements and the City of Chicago.
On Nov 6, 2024, at 09:57, Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
Hey all,
I know that many of us may be mentally distracted this morning – due to the mortifying circumstances we now find ourselves in…again – but I wanted to let you know that the meeting will be a chance to take a break from that and really dive into some critical thinking and reflection. I’ve been preparing the deck and I have to admit, the distraction from reading my FB and CNN, has been helpful.  
 
So, I hope you will still join us with your insights…and that we might be even more motivated, together, to figure out how we can help LCW more be more successful at making the changes in the world that are now even more necessary.
 
Thx,
R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
LCW

I wanted to follow up and send over this guide, 
PPC101
, which we find helps most advertisers progress their knowledge about the inner workings of pay-per-click marketing.

subject: RE: Strategy Session
body:
Ok, I have watched the recording – and reviewed the documents you’ve sent. I have some feedback and some ideas on how to move forward.
Let me know when you’d like to chat.
 
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, November 4, 2024 10:23
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Strategy Session 
 
Good Morning Randy,
 
Attached I am including the word doc I created before the exercise we did as a team with my own breakdown of 'why's. There are three iterations in that doc; pre-edit version where Chuck edited what I initially did, before we spoke to you. 
 
The powerpoint is what we started to complete during the session. Unfortunately, we only got through level 2 (slide 6) with the 'why' exercise.
 
I am going to move forward this week with some of the solutions Chuck and I started discussing and talk to Chuck about the below in more detail about the strategy, action steps, and implementation dates. I think letting the team know we are implementing 1-2 solutions (ie. scoro tasks and instructional designer) will be a good start once Chuck and I finalize. Open to your thoughts.
 
Alisa's proposed Solutions;
Scoro Tasks
Instructional Designer (non-US based)
Consultant (re-org; hiring/letting go)
Sales (re-org; hiring/letting go)
Power BI reports
PM roles (we currently have 3 part-time, making it 1-2 full time PM and combining with marketing and IT)
Marketing Plan
Graphic Design (re-org to combine with Instructional Design or separate with lower cost option)
COO (a role that partner with Chuck and ultimately can grow into Chuck's succession)
Product Expansion (CE credits in financial services, AI capabilities, and IT)
 
Please let me know your thoughts,
 
Alisa

subject: Register now: GROWING DEIB AND INTERCULTURAL CONSCIOUSNESS
body:
Register now: GROWING DEIB AND INTERCULTURAL CONSCIOUSNESS ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Dear Randy,
We hope to see you on November 13th, for another inciteful Wednesday Webinar. 
Webinar
'GROWING DEIB AND INTERCULTURAL CONSCIOUSNESS'
 
 
 
 
November 13th, 2024 @ 11:30AM ET
 
 
 
 
 
How do you move corporations to focus on their human resources? How do you get them to grow their DEIB and intercultural consciousness? Transformational learning builds on the premise that human beings need to understand the meaning of their experience. For some, an experience can be so transforming the old patterns or ways of perceiving are no longer relevant. Learn from Lewis Griggs what happened to him and how he has applied that to his work with others to grow their DEIB and intercultural consciousness. Join us to reflect on your own transformational experiences.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Presenter, Lewis Brown Griggs,
 co-founded Griggs Productions in 1982, a venture that resulted in 23 training videos and guides, an interactive e-learning program, The first National Diversity Conference, and two books: 
Going International 
and
 Valuing Diversity
. His training videos and services span over 6,000 corporations, academic institutions, and government agencies, benefiting individuals, teams, and organizations. In a TED Talk, the Gift of Near Death, he shared his wisdom and insights gained from near death experiences. A pioneer in diversity he has a career as an Active Leadership Coach.

Non-Member Registration

subject: IDI Platform Launch Delayed
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Launch Delayed
Due to an unforeseen delay in the development process, we have decided to postpone the launch of the IDI Platform. We are dedicated to delivering a complete platform that enhances the experience for you and your respondents. We anticipate the Platform will launch before the end of 2024 and will provide a new timeline as soon as we have more information.
In the meantime, the current IDI Assessment Website will continue to function as it has been, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption. We understand that this delay may impact your planning, and we sincerely appreciate your understanding and patience during this time.

subject: UChicago PRIDE Alumni News and Events
body:
Hope to see you soon!
 
Hi UChicago Alumni PRIDE!
We hope this note finds you in good health and happy autumn holiday spirit! We are thrilled to inform you of an opportunity to gather in gratitude alongside students on campus this fall. 
 
Save the Date: Harvest Meal with LGBTQ Student Life
Thursday, November 21
6:00PM - 8:00PM
Hyde Park Campus
Interest Form
 
Celebrate the harvest season with gratitude for queer and trans community at UChicago. We invite alumni to join current students for a catered meal serving up all the classics and new favorites. There will be opportunities for participants to gain insights into the student experience (then and now!) and share life’s wisdom.
 
To receive updates about this event, please complete our 
interest form
. Alumni seats will be ticketed to help offset the cost of the program. More details to come soon!
 
Presented by LGBTQ Student Life with support from UChicago Alumni PRIDE.
Join the UChicago Alumni PRIDE 
Facebook
 group to connect with fellow alumni and browse in-person and virtual events on our UChicago Alumni & Friends 
club site
.
See you in person and on the Zoom screen soon!
-Your UChicago PRIDE Board
 
 
For questions
, please email 
UChicago Alumni PRIDE 
at 
alumni@alumnimail.uchicago.edu
 or via phone at 
1.800.955.0065 
 
 
 
 
 
The University of Chicago
5801 South Ellis Avenue, Chicago, IL 60637

unsubscribe
.

manage your preferences
 for all alumni clubs and affinity groups.
